Reviews.Title: “Comodo e pulito”
Reviews.Author: Triz012
Reviews.Content: It is placed at three stops from train station. From the stop to the hotel it takes 2min and only two bridges. All this is great! The room eas perfectly clean and cosy. I did not lime the tipical venetian tourist stile, but it as neat and tidy. Breakfas was pretty good. But the best part is to have it in a nice place with a balcony to the Canal Grande. Service is precise amd fast. I gol deffinetly come back there. I visited the hotel with my 4yr old girl and my 8yr boy. Price was the best part of it!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: il_bale
Reviews.Content: We (me, wife and 20 months old son) were here in April 2012. The hotel is a nice old building located in the S.Croce quarter on the Canal Grande, not far from the Rialto bridge. We had one of the rooms on the ground floor, which was large but with low ceiling and dimly lit (it was facing the opposite building across a small canal, and had two small cellar-like windows), with a nice-looking and clean bathroom. I can't complain because it wasn't expensive (90Euros), but I can only imagine how nice the view from the highest floors must be. The staff was friendly and helpful. The best things about the hotel were the location, the breakfast room's balcony (go early to secure a table, there is only two) and the bar's terrace on the Canal Grande. The worst part was probably the breakfast, cheap insta-coffee and machine-dispensed juice and yoghurt. The pastries were nice though. Also, based on other hotels I visited, I wouldn't call this one a 4 stars, 3 at best. But perhaps the better rooms deserve the extra star. Note that we had to pay an extra 10 euros per night for the cot. I don't have any other experience of hotels in Venice, but we were happy of what we got and would definitely go back if we had the chance.

Reviews.Title: “In one word: GORGEOUS”
Reviews.Author: Sagrr A
Reviews.Content: Completely worth every penny and the other 6 people with me would attest to this. Everything was top class. Breakfast, rooms, staff, location - name it! It's on the water, there's a taxi station for the hotel (not every hotel has this! :) ). What a gorgeous location. Fantastic rooms with superb chandeliers and good bathrooms with a tub and top class plumbing :) RECOMMEND highly!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: Xbow11
Reviews.Content: Needed to find accommodation for 1 night and via the Internet found a room for 72 EUR. It's a wonderful hotel overlooking the Grand Canal and situated close to the fish market, shops and Rialto Bridge. A decent buffet breakfast is served and if you're an early riser secure yourself a table for two on the terrace and follow the Venetians during the bustle of early morning life along the Canal. The room was spacious with very comfortable mattress and the bathroom was new and tastfully decorated. The staff was very professional and helpful. It far surpassed the bed & breakfast I was committed to moving on to at a slighty lower rate.

Reviews.Title: “Venice again a year later!”
Reviews.Author: EilidhG
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel, wonderful staff, wonderful location, wonderful city. We hope to visit again next year.

Reviews.Title: “A charming, elegant hotel right by the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: davering
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our wedding anniversary weekend in December, and we loved every minute of it. It's within a short walking distance of the San Stae vaporetto stop and the Rialto Bridge. It's decorated in typical elegant Venetian style, with spacious clean bedrooms and big comfortable beds. The breakfast is great and the staff very friendly and welcoming. We would certainly choose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, Charming Hotel with Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Joanne R
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a lot of old world charm. It is on the Grand Canal in a convenient location to the vaporetto and the Rialto Bridge. The breakfast had an excellent selection of food choices, including an American breakfast. The beds were very comfortable and the triple bedroom that we had on the third floor was very large by European standards. There were a lot of stairs to the third floor, which would be difficult for someone who has trouble climbing stairs. The room was clean with a modern bathroom. Overall, a lovely and charming hotel that we would stay in again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: DonnaH48
Reviews.Content: I went with my three sisters and we had a superior room with 4 twin beds. This turned out to be 2 bedrooms and a bathroom on the first floor overlooking the courtyard. Its an old building with loads of character. The rooms weren't overly large but they were clean and comfortable, warm and with wonderful large windows. The staff were amazing. They couldn't do enough for us, were knowledgable, charming and really helpful. The location is fantastic. It took only a few minutes to walk to the Rialto bridge and market and another 10 to San Marco. Tip 1. You can walk most places easily so don't feel you need to buy the 3 day tickets. Tip 2. The hotel will sell you boat tiockets direct from the local stop to the airport. Great value for â‚¬15 each. Tip 3. Restaurants can be expensive but you can buy some great hot snacks including pizza slices for a few euros. Tip 4. the bar in the hotel is reasonably cheap and you can sit on the wonderful terrace watching canal life go by in comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Cathy B
Reviews.Content: The hotel was located on the Grand Canal walking distance to all the major "must see" sites. The rooms were large and decorated beautifully. Front desk staff provided us with all the information we needed to book tours and helped us with our restaurant choices. Nice breakfast provided every morning in a room overlooking the Grand Canal. We were traveling with our adult children and it was great having a card room that we could gather and have a glass of wine and play cards.

Reviews.Title: “Super stay in Venice, Italy”
Reviews.Author: bigFootzx
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was beautiful, clean,REASONABLE and good location. The staff was very helpful. Room was large and comfortable. If I ever go back I would stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place and location”
Reviews.Author: AJeanA
Reviews.Content: We found this via Trip Advisor, and we were enchanted with the hotel from the moment that someone helped us find the location. :) Everything about the hotel is charming- the signs, the courtyard, the interior, the rooms, the location, the friendly & helpful staff, and the view. We had a canal view room, and we absolutely loved just sitting in the window, looking out at the boats. We were close to the fish market, which was the highlight of our trip. Get here by 8am, if you want to see the full selection of fish, including a whole swordfish. We explored much of Venice, but no neighborhood felt as warm and magical as our area. We would totally come back and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect.”
Reviews.Author: Anne R
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the lovely San Cassiano with our 2 teenage children in January in room 103 facing the magnificent Grand Canal. We found the room to be perfect it was furnished in true venetian style with Murano chandalier rich red walls and drapes nothing seemed worn out. The location was ideal we walked everywhere and caught the ferry from nearby St Stae. The breakfast was very nice, and the staff were lovely and very helpful. We will recommend it to our friends and will return ourselves to stay one day.

Reviews.Title: “Really?”
Reviews.Author: travel_jenius
Reviews.Content: Did I miss something? The good - the internet service (paid service), drapes, and the hand blown light fixtures. The Bad - the hotel is difficult to get to if you have luggage, the breakfast was edible (yogurt dispensed from a machine and horrible juices), but the least desirable of all the hotels on my trip, the tv is difficult to use, the bathroom is approximately 4 1/2 - 6 ft including a bathtub, toilet, bidet, and sink. Once you enter it is full. The bedroom is the smallest I have ever had for a hotel (or even a bed and breakfast). Staff was less than helpful. Not having a concierge, staff provides suggestions, however the restaurants which were selected were not up to par. The Disgusting - I pulled back the comforter and found a pubic hair on a made bed. Then I pulled back the pillow and found two more.

Reviews.Title: “January in Venice”
Reviews.Author: timbo1959
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights here in January. We were upgraded to a Grand Canal view which was great.The whole stay here was great and we would thoroughly recommend this hotel and staff and would visit again .

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Friendly”
Reviews.Author: garynvaishali
Reviews.Content: My wife n I stayed January 2012, along with my parents in another room. The hotel staff were friend upon arrival and throughout our 4 night stay. The boat from the airport is only 1 block away ouer 2 bridges making a short 5 min walk max. Would stay in same hotel anytime i return to Venice. Great choice at breakfast, cereal, cold foods, hot foods etc. Only downfall in no lifts but the staff a very helpfull for those who may find stairs a little hard.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mattbeswick
Reviews.Content: Provided the perfect base for a long weekend away. Travelling as a group (13 of us in total) meant that we needed somewhere which was central enough to suit the needs of everyone... the San Cassiano didn't disappoint. Positives: - Great Location. - Calm, relaxed atmosphere. - Excellent service from the staff - particularly in the bar. - Fairly large rooms which are clean and comfortable. - Lovely views of the Grand Canal. Negatives: - Breakfast. Everything comes out of a machine, including the orange juice and yoghurt. Bacon, eggs and sausages are provided but I wouldn't recommend. - Steep stairs, especially if you're on the 3rd floor. This didn't affect me as I'm young and fighting fit... but if you're of an older or unhealthy generation they're likely to kill you off. Overall, well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Getaway”
Reviews.Author: LizPhoenixInn
Reviews.Content: Four of us booked a 4 day trip during the slow season which turned out to be perfect! The hotel was great value for the money, convenient-but slightly off the beaten path. The view and food at breakfast couldn't be beat and the front desk clerks were always willing to help us out and answer questions. We felt safe and comfortable and really enjoyed our time at Ca Favretto!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: DubaiCanuk
Reviews.Content: Loved the location close to the Pescheria (fish market) and the S. Stae vaporetti stop. Bathroom was updated and great feature to have the heater which kept towels warm. Downside is I had a single room and the bed was a tad old, it had a sunken part from being well used. Directions - The church will be infront of you as you exit the vaporetti. You will see a metal bridge, Ponte Giovaneill on your left, cross the bridge and go right. Take your next left and cross another bridge. Go right, it will be your only choice. At next crossstreet take a left and go over another bridge. Go straight and you will cross a street Calle Regina Corner, the hotel is the next left. If you forgot the directions there is a trash can just before the bridge that has a map of how to get to the hotel. Very clever idea I thought.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to base yourself in Venice.”
Reviews.Author: lindasydney1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a day that the vaparetto was on strike so we were so happy that Ca' Favretto was close to the railway station. It's nicely situated, within walking distance from the best places in the city. The staff on the front desk were so helpful and made us feel very welcome. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Service, Beautiful Building”
Reviews.Author: mel4
Reviews.Content: I selected this place after reading a number of reviews and checking on the location. I was pleased with my choice, albeit that I agree withthose who remarked about the bed (single room), beign hard and narrow. The pillows were not very comfortable either, but those are my only negative comments. The staff there is wonderful, very helpful, courteous and welcoming. Location is only slightly off the beaten path, which I was pleased with as it provided peace and quiet at night.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad experience on the phone”
Reviews.Author: rosaerosamrosa
Reviews.Content: Hi people, I called to make a change in a reservation from a single to a 3 BED-ROOM, and instead of being happy the guy that answered was so disappointing that due to that I won't go there neither if it is for free. First of all not Italian second of all not pro to customers. This is not the kind of service a person expect for such a structure. If this is the service...bye bye Italy...I am very sorry about that everyone else is going to pass us.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - great view of the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: WisDC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the San Cassiano Hotel during our recent two night stay in Venice. Our room was great - very large, especially for Europe. We had a view of the Grand Canal from our room, which was pretty amazing. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful. The breakfast was fairl typical of what we found at other hotels in Italy. Although they had jam dispensers which were pretty cool.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty, Pricey and Chilly”
Reviews.Author: PubPerspectives
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in late October and had one of the fanciest rooms in the House, facing the Grand Canal. The room was nice, with a daybed that our four-year-old slept in comfortably. The big issue is that the room was utterly freezing, no matter what we did with the thermostat...be prepared for this. In addition, be careful of booking tours through the hotel: they will offer you a "free" ride to Murano, but if you don't buy anything, you'll need to find your own way back. In addition, the tours through the hotel are very expensive and, once you find out the price and try to cancel, they will tell you "it is not possible." The location is very nice. The service is indifferent. As with many things in Venice, you'll wonder why it is you're paying so much. Getting the room with the Grand Canal view is a toss up. There is no balcony and the view is very narrow, so you may find yourself underwhelmed for the premium you are paying.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for holiday in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Pam C
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in this hotel and thought it was a great base for visiting the sights of the city. It was in a quiet, peaceful location away but only 5 minutes walk away from the Rialto Bridge and within very easy walking distance of a good range of restaurants. It was closee to San Stae and so easy to reach when arriving from the airport by water bus. The hotel was full of character and the staff very friendly and helpful. There is a small bar and a terrace over the canal which was lovely for sitting on in the evening. Our room, 323, was well furnished in Venetian style and had a partial view of the Grand Canal. It was a superior room but I felt that it was really more worthy of 'standard' - nothing wrong with it but nothing spectacular either!. Bathroom had sloping ceilings ( you had to watch your head when coming out of the shower) but was clean and modern.There was a buffet breakfast which was adequate - the breakfast room was rather cramped and even in October it was a bit of a squash. I would definitely recommend this as a good place to stay if visiting Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Emjay7
Reviews.Content: Just has 4 nights at Ca` Favretto, great situation for seeing Venice, hotel staff all friendly and helpfull. Our room 101 was small but adequate and decorated in the style of the hotel, the bathroom had a brilliant shower and was clean and modern. Our room overlooked a small canal which was a few feet away from the Grand Canal, the boats would go past the window early in the morning on the way to Rialto market. Great. The hotel has a lovely homely feel to it, it was nice to sit in the bar or on the balcony with a drink watching the goings on on the Canal Grande. On our last day the hotel arranged for us a water taxi back to the airport from the hotel landing stage, definitely a `must do`, to leave (if you must) in style! Brilliant hotel, would recommend and return.

Reviews.Title: “Well Located Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pbm1411
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 4 night stay at the San Cassiano Hotel in Venice. The hotel was in an ideal location for the water ferry station and the Rialto bridge, but far enough away from the crowds. It has a great waterfront veranda which is a lovely place to sit with a coffee or glass of wine. Although our bedroom was very small it was clean and had every thing we needed. The staff were extremly helpful and very pleasant. We would reccommend this hotel to anyone thinking of visiting Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon heaven”
Reviews.Author: PTCooper
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this beautiful hotel for 3 nights while on honeymoon in July 2010. After two weeks sailing a 52 footer in the Adriatic we thought we would end our honeymoon off with 4 days in Venice. That turned out to be one of the best decisions we'll ever make, mainly because of this hotel. We were given a room on the Grand Canal with a beautiful view. A large room with a lounge area and an en-suite, mini-bar, tv and beautifully furnished. We could quite happily live there forever. This was the first hotel I've stayed in where I was sorry to go adventuring in the morning and very happy to return, for any reason at any time, during the day. It was a true oasis in the proverbial desert of Venice. Sitting on the deck overlooking the Canal, drinking a glass of wine and watching Venician life pass us by was a real treat. When we return to Venice, we will return to this fantastic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Well located friendly hotel, with all you need...”
Reviews.Author: BCMMan
Reviews.Content: The Hotel San Cassiano Ca'Favretto is very well located near all the major sites of venice. The hotel is comfotable, clean and the staff were extremely helpful and friendly. Our room was not huge, but more than adequate, with aircon, minibar and good size bathroom. We also had a very small balcony but enabled us to sit out on an evening and soak up more lovely venetian atmosphere. There is no lift and the hotel staff did all they could to help us with our bags and luggage, but not suitable if you have mobility issues. Breakfast is unsophisticated, but a good choice and quality was great. We had a brilliant time and would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view of the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: purpleirises1
Reviews.Content: We (family of 4 with college age kids) stayed there for 4 days near the end of June. What I liked best about the hotel was being right on the canal. We had a canal facing room for the 1st night - made me feel like Angelina Jolie in the Tourist! Our second room was less grand, but more affordable and had a small balcony with a partial view of the canal. I really enjoyed returning in the evening and sitting out front with a drink, watching the canal traffic go by. The hotel is expensive relative to the size of the rooms, but this is Venice and you pay for location, so enjoy the view of the canal! I think others have done a good job of describing the hotel, rooms, breakfast, etc. so I will give you my tips instead. My tips for your stay would be: 1) Visit the fish market near the Rialto bridge, we saw amazing things, huge sword fish, and all kinds of fresh seafood. Go in the morning, all will be gone in the afternoon and you won't even know there was a fish market there. 2) Near the fish market there is a traghetto (traghetti) pier and you can get rowed to the other side for only 50 cents. The tragetto is a 2 man gondola that ferries people across the canal. 3) Bring a map with you, especially if you plan to return to the hotel after the shops close. Things look very different when they pull the shutters down and you can't use the shop windows to navigate. Thank goodness one of my kids has a good sense of direction because I would have been lost forever. 4) Restaurants get more expensive the closer you get to St. Marks. If you want to eat on the canal for a reasonable price, try the 2 restaurants that are on the canal between the fish market and the Rialto bridge. The ones between the Rialto and St. Marks were much pricier and the tables are very close together (didn't enjoy smoker's smoke and ashes blown by the wind into my face). 5) The hotel offers a free water taxi (one way) to Mirano to see the glass blowing. The water taxi ride was a lot of fun and there wasn't too much pressure to buy - which I would have if prices weren't so high (most things were over 800 euros!). Be warned, you have to find your own way back by water bus (tell them when you get on that you have to buy tickets, if don't, you can be fined for trying to sneak on with out paying). 6) Taking the water bus to and from the airport to the hotel was not a problem for us, I think there were only two bridges to carry the suitcases over. I would pack lighter next time as 20 kgs is a little heavy to carry over the bridges. You get on and off the water bus at San Stae. When arriving, cross in front of the church, heading to your left and look for a very small bridge you will be on the right path to the hotel (do not take the wide road straight ahead from the bus stop). I down loaded a google map and had no problems finding the hotel, it is a 5 - 8 minute walk. The pick up times for the water bus are listed at the stop they ran every 1/2 hour. I think it was the orange line that runs between the San Stae and the airport, but double check. http://www.venice.nu/vapmap/vapomapLatest.jpg

Reviews.Title: “OK but not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: FifiLincolnshire
Reviews.Content: We were a little disappointed by the San Cassiano having read lots of excellent reviews on trip advisor. Our room was ok - clean and air conditioned. We didn't expect it to overlook the Grand Canal as we had booked the cheaper rate but we found the room and en suite basic and a little 'run down' in the decor . It is in a good location around 10 minutes walk from the Rialto and a the same again from St Marcs square. There are lots of restaurants in the area (although the San Cassiano itself doesn't have a restaurant). The breakfast was buffet style with lots of choice and a couple of tables on the balcony overlooking the Canal and the coffee was excellent (though I drank so much I gave myself palpitations!). The staff in the breakfast room where charming and helpful. One big problem with the hotel is the lack of bar staff - there is a lovely area overlooking the canal where you can sit and erm well you could have a drink if there was anyone around to serve you! One waiter , Ernesto, is fantastic but on his days off I was told the waiter was too busy to serve me and 'you will have to wait Madam' - not what you expect from a 4 star hotel. Other times we sat for over an hour and resorted to getting a drink from our mini bar and bringing it down. If you are visiting Venice then the Italian Government has imposed a 4 euro a night 'tax' per person which you will have to pay on top of your hotel fees and the San Cassiano insists this is paid in cash so be warned.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with lots of character”
Reviews.Author: kinvara126
Reviews.Content: In June this year I visited Venice with my son and daughter - both adults. We stayed for three nights at the San Cassiano Hotel - also known as Residenza d'Epoca Ca' Favretto San Cassiano. I visit Venice quite frequently and this was the second time I have stayed at the San Cassiano and it didn't disappoint. It is quite difficult to find at first , but we managed pretty well after the first couple of attempts! Fairly expensive, it compares favourably with the prices of other hotels that are directly on the Grand Canal. Wonderfully old fashioned, with slightly undulating terrazzo floors and staircase, it is decorated in typical Venetian style. The bar has an outside area, which is a terrace right on the Grand Canal and how lovely it was to have our aperitivo sitting there watching the hustle and bustle on this fantastic waterway! The beds were comfortable and everything spotless. Breakfast in the wonderful breakfast room upstairs was excellent. Very pleasant staff on reception and in the bar helped to make this a very pleasant visit indeed.

Reviews.Title: “'Staying on the Grand Canal in Venice, Italy!”
Reviews.Author: HAPPYGRANDPARENTS
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week at the San Cassiano Residenza d/Epoca Ca' Favretto, Venice, Italy in late August. While they do offer rooms facing the Grand Canal, we were in a less expensive room. They have a dock facing the Grand Canal where we frequently sat to talk with other guests; read; or enjoy a glass of wine. You can take your own or purchase from the hotel. It is a historic building; the staff is just great; and it is affordable with FREE breakfast each morning which includes scrambled eggs, bacon, etc. There is also a balcony with room for two couples to eat breakfast facing the Grand Canal. The hotel also offers information regarding getting there from the airport which is very helpful. You can check the hotel online and they do offer discounts. We received a 15% discount on our first three nights. We lost our camera in the airport HOWEVER it is in 'Lost and Found' and have found someone to personally pick it up for us so we cannot post any photos right now. They will not ship your 'found' item to you . One last note: There are no elevators in this hotel but the staff is always available to help.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful . . . fabulous views . . . great location . . .delicious breakfast”
Reviews.Author: S1772
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Our room overlooked the canal and had a fabulous view. The room was very nice and the location great. The included breakfast was a nice surprise. It was very good. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This exceeded our expectations especially considering the location and price”
Reviews.Author: mazza4442
Reviews.Content: This hotel was charming, and picturesque and the staff were really lovely .We enjoyed having breakfast on the beautiful balcony every morning watching the activity on the waterways early in the day. When searching for somewhere to stay in Venice we really wanted a central location so that we could walk to most sites and this hotel was just that. We walked to the Rialto and to St Marks square, and to the markets and the shops were all around us. It was easy access to food, which is important when travelling with teenagers. When arriving, the trip to the hotel from the train station was easy. The public water bus stop closest to the hotel, was just a few stops away from the train, only make sure you have a map and location of the hotel marked on it so you know where to get off. We were lucky enough to have some English tourists help us out with directions.When we checked out and needed to go to the airport we caught the private water taxi which cost 90 euro. I was hesitant at first but after talking to others realised it was just way too difficult for 4 people with luggage to go with public transport to the airport.We caught the taxi from the hotels' lobby, as they have their own water stop which made life easy.It actually ended up being a lot of fun and the kids enjoyed it more than the gondola ride!

Reviews.Title: “Room on Grand Canal took you back in time”
Reviews.Author: Vilmar A
Reviews.Content: Elegant and old, really fit into the whole venice feeling of getting away from real world. Lots of stairs and initallly difficult to find, all was forgiven with the view of the canal. Breakfast was filling and staff was helpful. Besides location really enjoyed taking water taxi directlly from hotel to airport. Quiet location away from main san marco attractions, be prepared to walk.

Reviews.Title: “So beautifully Venice on the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: Kesslane
Reviews.Content: If you want the real Venice experience, this is it. This converted 14th century villa is so charming and beautiful. The rooms are very modern with great AC and bathrooms but retain their charm with fixtures and furniture. The Hotel opens right on the Grand Canal but is within easy walking distance through small shop-lined streets to St. Marks. So wonderful. They had a room that slept my family of four (two small children); this is rare for Venice and Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Venice-romanitic, beautiful views, wondeful feel on the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: WaHoo84
Reviews.Content: We arrived early after disembarking from a Silver Seas cruise and taking a Water Taxi from the port. The front desk took our bags and we left to explore Venice by foot. It was our fourth visit to Venice and we have stayed at wonderful hotels, but this is the first that had it all. Great staff, a fantastic view right on the grand canal, a nice bar and a wonderful breakfast. We enjoyed the fact that it was a bit of a walk to S. Marks square..we walked, stopped in cafes, ate pizza and fresh mussels in small restaurants, visited beautiful churches and museums we had never seen. Our room was huge, directly over the canal. The bathroom was nice and everything was very clean. We found this hotel through a review on trip advisor and were very happy with the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: chicagola
Reviews.Content: Venice was the last of 5 stops for us on a recent trip to Italy. Bear in mind that in general my view of Venice is not entirely positive. With that said....the hotel was fine. Musty smell upon entering but I imagine every hotel in Venice smells musty from the water. Old school, heavy, dark decor. Again no elevator and we were on the third floor, mother-in-law on the "first floor" which involved a full flight of stairs. Decent sized rooms but very dark. Staff were all very friendly. Don't really have any point of comparison to other places in Venice. It was right off the Grand Canal though and an acceptable walk to Point Rialto...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: tiger077
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, don't know why people moan about it being hard to find, you just need to buy a decent map before you get there. The hotel itself is lovely but if you are like us and cannot afford to go for the rooms overlooking the grand canal you may end up with the dark and gloomy room 217 that we had. This room looks out onto the drainpipe of the building next door, and you need to keep the lights on at all times. This was a bit depressing as we were there for a full week. If you leant out of the bathroom window you could however get a view of the grand canal, this brings me to the bathroom itself, whilst a generally clean room, the toothbrush mug had the residue of the last guests toothbrushes in it and there were brown stains at the base of the toilet where it joined the tiles, this could have been easily remedied with a drop of bleach. Good points though were the crisp cotton sheets and reasonably comfortable bed,and the traditional mosaic style floor is lovely and cool to walk on. The hotel staff were also very nice, everyone of them seemed happy in their work and the little porter was especially cheery. Breakfast was fine [ hot food not very warm though] and being able to sit on the balcony overlooking the grand canal 3 mornings was great, we also loved the friendly seagull! The weather was fantastic whilst we were in Venice so we didn't need to stay in our dark room much, but if I stayed again I would have to save up for a 'room with a view' and advise fellow travellers to do the same!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, lovely stay”
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights prior to a cruise. Arrived by water taxi as recommended by others, and it was worth the extra expense to avoid lugging suitcases around in middle of the day, particularly as the hotel entrance is tucked away. Had a quad room on the second floor which was clean and comfortable and spacious and air con was good. The friends we were traveling with had room 104 on the first flor which looked out onto the Grand C anal. Breakfast fine. Lovely to have a drink overlooking the Grand Canal pre eating out (bar prices reasonable). The staff were helpful and the pizzeria they recommended with 10% discount was our best meal during the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel right on Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: RIUCapeVerde
Reviews.Content: A typically venetian hotel suituated on the Grand Canal. Rooms are small but are well furnished. A/C is a bit noisy. Staff excellent and breakfast good.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast on a balcony by the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: B00Tee
Reviews.Content: Courteous reception staff helped us with our luggage at 10am in the morning and put it all into secure storage so we could travel round unencumbered. They also organised a cup of coffee on the balcony outside and cold glasses of water on a sweltering morning - all hours before the official check-in time. We had a small room on the first floor but it was comfortable and very quiet. We had our breakfast in the open air on a tiny balcony overlooking the grand canal and watching the boats go past - so worth every penny!!

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: JaneFarrington
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Venice late at night and thankfully we had organised a water taxi to the hotel! As the hotel is on the Grand Canal it has its own landing jetty, we were greeted by the night time receptionist who was very nice and gave us our room key, there is no lift in the hotel so late at night climbing 3 flights of stairs was tiring but this only became part of the hotels charm, it is decorated beautifully with lots of antiques and murano glass. Breakfast is served on the 2nd floor and was fairly basic but totaly adequate before going out for the day, there were a couple of tables outside looking over the canal which were very popular. The hotel is very close to all the attractions once you have mastered the tiny streets which to me all started to look the same! A charmng hotel in a beautiful & romantic city!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: AnnieMay24
Reviews.Content: After reading all of the reviews and trying to find a hotel in good location and that would accommodate a family of four (including two teenage daughters), I chose this hotel and I'm so happy I did. We loved the location right on the Grand Canal. After a day of sightseeing, it was the perfect place to come home to. We loved sitting on the little deck, with a glass of wine and looking out at beautiful Venice. We were within walking distance of everything but just far enough away from the crowds to be able to relax for a while and then head out again for dinner. I would highly recommend the hotel and look forward to staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Authentic style”
Reviews.Author: B H
Reviews.Content: We had a nice stay at Residenza d'Epoca San Cassiano. The hotel has an authentic style which fits Venice. The reception is very helpful. The hotel seems clean and the breakfast as quite good. The breakfast area has a few tables available on balcony with view to the canal. Unfortunately not enough tables for all to sit there, but the few lucky ones getting a table seemed to have a marvelous view during breakfast. Our room was a big family room just by the reception on ground floor. The room had all the normal facilities and a good tv-system. The window in the bathroom was facing a very narrow canal and the water seemed to have an edge higher up than our bathroom floor (this was not meant in a negative way). I guess they were about leveled though. You have a boat-stop a few blocks away. We could also walk quite easily to central areas even if it was like moving inside a labyrinth. Found some ok restaurants reasonably close, but the area of the hotel is rather quiet which means you have to walk some squares to find more life and noise.

Reviews.Title: “Off the beaten path but that is part of its charm”
Reviews.Author: topherashley
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little hard to find (as is everything in Venice) but once you get there you will be pleasantly surprised. It has a great little deck on the back overlooking the grand canal. If you can get a room facing that it would be amazing. Our room faced the Courtyard as we were on a budget after a couple nights at the Hilton Stucky in Venice (a much better hote than than this). However, for the price this is a good hotel. The service was friendly, the room was clean, you can walk to everything and find your way back fairly easily. it is on a very quiet street. (so quiet we slept with our windows cracked and never woke up) This hotel gives you a great flavor of Venice and I would highly recommend it. Catching a taxi off the dock to get back to the airport made our departure a little easier to handle.

Reviews.Title: “Rose-red hotel, timeless, elegant, and on the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: veronica59
Reviews.Content: A short water taxi ride from Santa Lucia station, San Cassiano Ca' Favretto is a delightful rose-red villa opening right on to the Grand Canal. It would be difficult to find a lovelier hotel in Venice. With a small terrace right on the Grand Canal, another two floors up in the breakfast salon overlooking the canal, the location is ideal. The Ca' d'Oro, one of the most famous palazzi in Venice, is almost opposite with its superb Gothic facade. Inside the hotel is elegant and sophisticated. Dating back to the quattrocento, there are stone staircases and spacious halls. The rooms are stylish with period furniture, up-to-date bathrooms and accessories, plus mini-bar and desk sets. The breakfast salon is pure 18th century. The reception is friendly and helpful, there is a bar and lounge and a comfortable outside terrace at the back of the hotel. On the edge of Santa Croce sestiere, in a quiet district, the hotel is a stone's throw, through a short labyrinth of Venetian alleys, from Campo San Cassiano with its church complete with a trio of Tintorettos, cafe-bar, and ice-cream stand. Across a lovely bridge over a pretty side canal is a tobacconist, a souvenir shop, and a terrace trattoria. Nearby are excellent restaurants (Osteria Antico Giardinetto and Vecio Fritolin being the best), . A tiny village on the doorstep of the hotel yet only 5 minutes walk from the Rialto Bridge. This is a wonderful hotel in a beautiful setting and absolutely perfect for visiting Venice. I recommend San Cassiano Ca' Favretto without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: travelnander
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have been more pleased with our stay at the San Cassiano Residenza d'Epoca Ca' Favretto in March 2011. Despite the high priced, we chose to take a private water taxi directly to the hotel. We arrived in the evening, and remember my previous experience of how hard it is to find streets and buildings in Venice if you are not familiar with the neighborhood, our choice if the water taxi was a good one. We were dropped off in the front entrance, right off the Grand Canal. Upon our arrival, the front desk had our rooms ready and the gracious porter helped us with our suitcases to our third floor room. As others have mentioned, they do not have an elevator and the stairs can be quite steep but it wasn't a problem for us. Our room was quite large, in fact larger than the most standard American hotel rooms. We've come to expect rooms in Europe to be on smaller side but it's never really an issue for us anyway. I don't plan to stay in a hotel room for very much when I'm in a beautiful city in Europe. The bathroom was also quite large and very clean. Our room overlooked a small canal but you could also see the Grande Canal on the side. The breakfast room was a beautiful room that had a small balcony you could eat on, overlooking the Grand Canal. As for location, we were initially concerned that it was a but off from the central locations but in hindsight, I thought it was perfect location. Were nestled in a neighborhood with locals but only a 15 minute walk from the Piazza San Marco. Once you reached the hotel's neighborhood, you were no longer jostling for space on the narrow streets, or worst, caught up with the zombie tour groups, following a tattered umbrella. There were plenty of restaurants and cafes just a three minute walk away with some great bakeries and restaurants close by. The farmers market was just right around the corner as well. Overall, I was very pleased with the hotel, with it's beautiful decor but the best part, was the location.

Reviews.Title: “Hope To Use Again”
Reviews.Author: Andrew G
Reviews.Content: Spent seven nights in early March. Loved every minute. We got room 219 with a Grand Canal view. Comfortable bed, lots of space, fantastic view. Bath a little bit small, but not a problem. Everything clean and tidy. Excellent breakfast. Breakfast room can be a tight squeeze, but get your timing right and it's fine. Friendly, helpful staff. We splashed out to arrive by water taxi -- fantastic. Highly recomended.

Reviews.Title: “Great little palace on the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: Debbylynne
Reviews.Content: Excellent multilingual staff and very good American style breakfast on the Grand Canal, all for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful romantic getaway, overlooking the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: JL_and_DLSouthampton
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the San Cassiano for a 3 night stay in February - beware, it can be rather chilly at this time of year! But the cold didn't take anything away from our stay. Venice is a wonderfully romantic city, whatever the weather. The hotel certainly lived up to the reviews we saw prior to booking - the staff are very friendly and welcoming. As an example, they were happy to lend us some wine glasses for some champagne we bought with us. We stumped up the extra money for a room (103) overlooking the Grand Canal - it was certainly worth it!! The room was HUGE! There is quite a lot of 'Canal traffic', even late into the night and early in the morning and we were worried that this would keep us awake, but with the window shutters closed (and even the windows ajar) you couldn't hear a thing. Comfortable beds and plenty of hanging/storage space in wardrobes and drawers. Room safe was useful too. TV in room, although we didn't watch it. The only downside (considering how big our room was!), was the tiny bathroom - there was a shower over the bath (perfectly fine and powerful) but if you like your baths, you would've struggled to sit/lie down in it! It was rather a 'one in, one out' deal with the bathroom! This is the only reason we didn't score a 5 for Rooms. However, considering the time you spend in the bathroom, I guess I would rather have the extra space in the bedroom so we can't really complain. Breakfast was included in our stay and was very good - bacon. eggs, toast, cereal, pastries, bread, ham, cheese.....plenty to choose from. In terms of location, San Cassiano is in a great spot - in the San Polo district, it is very centrally located, close to the Rialto bridge that crosses the Grand Canal. We booked a shared Water Taxi in advance of our visit as a transfer to and from the Airport (http://www.venicelink.com/) - this was well worth the money as it saves worrying about getting the rather confusing public transport and finding your own way to the hotel, especially if you haven't been to Venice before. As the hotel backs onto the canal, the water taxi can moor up at the hotel so you're dropped off right outside! We booked the San Cassiano and paid in advance which saved us around 15-20% by booking directly through the hotel's own website. We'd highly recommend this hotel to anyone, but as a young married couple on a romantic getaway, it suited us perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Prime location and beautiful peaceful room!”
Reviews.Author: locust1028
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the San Cassiano during part of our honeymoon. The hotel was in a great location-very close to the vaporetto stop and walking distance to all. We found the hotel easily and quickly learned our way around the city thanks to its central location. It was not in a touristy neighborhood however. We wanted to stay somewhere central but not in the midst of chaos. The location of the San Cassiano was perfect. It was close to all so we were in and out of our hotel several times throughout the days and was in a very quiet area. The hotel staff upgraded us to a beautiful room overlooking the grand canal with large windows and shutters that we could leave open and listen/look out onto the canal which made for a very peaceful/relaxing stay in the room. The room was beautiful with a very Venetian feel (as it should be I guess.) It was a large room with a nice bathroom-very clean. The service at the hotel was great with a large breakfast which we enjoyed quite a bit. We had trouble dialing internationally at first and the front desk patiently explained it to us until we understood. We found their service to be great and the hotel itself was perfect-we would definitely stay here again-in a second! We sat out on the deck on the canal a few times and enjoyed a drink from the bar or a cappucino-it was really a lovely and relaxing atmosphere. I wish I was there now:)

Reviews.Title: “A beauty on the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: Eltel6
Reviews.Content: A wonderful old fashioned hotel in an ancient palazzo on the Grand Canal. If you favour Hyatt or Hilton then stay away -- but for the rest of us who appreciate a traditional locanda, this is a gem. The staff are all lovely and absolutely charming and most have worked there for decades. There's an amazing terrace right on the Grand Canal -- worth almost any price but astonishing when you consider how much less you're paying here. The breakfast room looks out onto the Canal too and when it's warm you can have your caffe e cornetto looking at the vaporetti and the Ca d'Oro (you can when it's cold too if you really want). This is the kind of hotel which has a big table with interesting books to read, and a cosy bar where the guests say hello and talk to one another. The rooms are sort of what you might call "faded glamour". Mine had a huge old Venetian chandelier and a window opening onto a small canal. My bed was perfectly comfortable and the shower very hot and strong, which is really all you need. The worst thing I could say about it is that one of the bedside lamps was wobbly and the cupboard holding the mini-bar looked like it had been built in the 1970s. Non importa. Every time I read reviews of Venice hotels that complain about small rooms or being "hard to find" I have to giggle. Please remember where you are... rooms are small here for a reason. And everything is hard to find in Venice... if that makes you unhappy then you've missed the point of this incredible city.

Reviews.Title: “Full of character with wonderful service! Excellent value.”
Reviews.Author: alltonnee
Reviews.Content: It's very hard to say a bad word about this hotel. The location is great (definitely difficult to find if arriving on foot, but with a mooring directly on the Grand Canal, arriving by water taxi is a very easy and stylish way to arrive, well worth the money!) Yes, it could definitely do with a lick of paint, it's definitely not 4 stars, but it just oozes character. The staff on check-in we're by far the friendliest I have spoken to in a long time making you feel extremely welcome. Although the room was small and the bathroom quite dated, it still had some character and the cleanliness was excellent. The breakfast was above par, and the location is perfect, close to the Rialto Bridge and a perfect base for those who like to walk. I would definitely recommend this hotel. The character and service perfectly make up for any minor cosmetic issues but hey, this is Venice! A perfect place to enjoy this beautuful city!

Reviews.Title: “Atmospheric, 'oldy worldy' style hotel, very sweet.”
Reviews.Author: CBirch76
Reviews.Content: My brain nearly exploded trying to find a boutique, reasonably priced hotel on the Grand canal but then I found this one. Perfect! I'd call it a 3 star, not 4 but it didn't lack anything and a lick of paint and some stair runners could make it more luxurious but it was very sweet. Reception were helpful, the room was very 'Venetian' - burgandy walls, paintings of Venice, matching drapes, bedding, chairs etc. We had a room on the 2nd floor overlooking the canal which was lovely - the bathrooms are pretty plain but who chooses a hotel for the bathroom? There was a nice choice at breakfast and the small bar was a welcome treat after hours of walking - make sure you check out the bottom shelf in the cabinet to the right of the door - VERY 'interesting' exhibits!!!! :0) The hotel was helpfully signposted on the walls of the narrow streets and you get your bearings very quickly as to where you are - near the fish / fruit market, rialto and 20 min to San Marco. Lovely trattorias in the area to eat in. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem, difficult to find !”
Reviews.Author: Josephien
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Ca' Favretto 5 nights with my mother and we had each a single room. Thanks god hers was on the first floor because mine was on the third floor and a few very steep staircases up ! While my mum's room was better decorated and more spacious, mine was a little tired looking but quieter and windows opening on a charming side canal What was terrible in both is the narrow size of the beds, so narrow that you could easily fall off turning around...But the hotel is a gem indeed, full of antiques and old furniture, it feels very pleasant and comfortable. Once you find it ! Conveniently located close to a vaporetto stop St Stae, it takes a superior sense of orientation to find your way through a maze of tiny lanes and up bridges until you reach the lovely, well-hidden outside patio. The staff is incredible nice, friendly and helpful, (special mention to the young gentleman with glasses at the reception, the breakfast lady , barman and maintenance young man !)( wish I 'd asked names) so it definitely is a place I would love to come back to if in Venice again. The breakfast room is narrow but with a litlle balcony and weather permitting, having your breakfast looking on the Grand Canal must be quite an experience ! The buffet is standard but good. A minus : a Four stars Hotel charging 3 euros for one hour online looks more than a little mean. Was never charged in other 4 stars. The location near the Rialto bridge is brilliant, away from the trashy atmosphere around St Marc, close to the daily Rialto market. The restaurants are more 'local' than touristic, less expensive and good. But avoid the aptly name 'Ali Tosis' with expensive awful frozen re-heated pizzas, on the corner of a little place. Try and find 'La Zucca' though, marvellous cuisine and wine and utterly for locals.

Reviews.Title: “The rooms are very tiny”
Reviews.Author: Redmax1962
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a quad share room and it was very small. We had to pack our suitcases on top of each other and it was hard to move around if we were all in there together. One of the other people we were travelling with was on his own and his room was also very small. The staff were very helpful and the food was really good. I am pretty sure the place is haunted as there was a lot of funny noises happening through the night. It was close to the town centre and very neat and tidy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and full of traditional character”
Reviews.Author: alanmsq
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel primarily because it offered a room with a view over the Grand Canal at a reasonable cost. We weren't disappointed, and can see why reviewers rate Ca' Favretto highly. In truth we think the hotel merits a good 3 star rating more than 4, but on the whole we thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. Location is excellent; not just the Grand Canal frontage, but the hotel's proximity to Rialto market and bridge, and just 5 minutes from the Rialto Mercato vaporetto stop and the S. Sofia traghetto, mean that getting anywhere is Venice from here is easy and convenient. It's also within very short walking distance of several decent restaurants. As other reviewers have mentioned, the hotel's own landing stage makes taking a water taxi a very special way to arrive at the hotel (we didn't, unfortunately!) Like many hotels and B&Bs in Venice, the outside belies the interior, which is full of period detail, plans of the building and, of course (as this was a painter's house) art. Decor is traditional and slightly worn, in a comfortable way. Public rooms are compact rather than palatial, in keeping with the fact that this was once a private house. There's a small but well-stocked bar where you can take a drink or tea / coffee at any time of day and a slightly incongruous reading / games room with a wall-mounted TV. Breakfast is served on the second floor in a room which is, frankly, too small for the number of hotel guests, so that it felt busy and cramped rather than a relaxing start to the day. But this is a minor gripe, and breakfast itself is pretty good. The staff are friendly and helpful and there is plenty of information in the hotel (maps, events etc). So, Ca' Favretto is a good choice if you want a great location, some character and tradition and, especially, a Grand Canal view.

Reviews.Title: “We love this great value hotel, our second visit and we will return.”
Reviews.Author: Mimiboo1st
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great position, on the Grand Canal with fabulous views from it's canal view rooms, close to the Rialto and the market, close to San Stae vaporetto stop but tucked away in a nice quiet location. Contact them before you book to make sure you get the best room available, they do vary quite a lot. Breakfast is in a great room with a balcony overlooking the Grand Canal, we wrapped up warm and had our coffee out there in the snow one morning! There is a little landing stage at the back of the hotel where you can sit and watch the bustle of the canal as well. I think this hotel offers incredible value for it's position. We stayed recently and the management could not have been more helpful when we asked to change room to one we have stayed in before and the breakfast lady is lovely!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, old world elegance.”
Reviews.Author: Bella00Emma
Reviews.Content: My husband & I took a city break to this hotel in Venice mid November with our 12 year old & 18 month old. It is well placed right on the Grand Canal with stunning views & its own boat landing platform which meant we could get a water taxi Airport - Hotel Door. Expensive at E100 but sensible with kids as Venice is a maze of little streets & steps & i wouldnt have fancied finding it from the Vaporetto stop!! Latterly on exploring by day we discovered that the stop is not far at all and really handy for the hotel. The hotel is really ideally placed, over the Rialto Bridge near the market. This meant that the little restaurants near the hotel were considerably cheaper than the ones over the bridge nearer St Marks Sq. They were also (accurately according to The Rough Guide) much more quaint, family run with great attention to detail as opposed to the more tourist orientated grandeur of the restaurants around St Marks Sq ...that said ... price wasnt the issue, we just like to find the real Italian rustic places which were in abundnace around this hotels location. We ate around St Marks Sq a couple of times and the restaurants were great too ...iv never had a bad meal in Italy!!! The Hotel had a lovely little bar which we enjoyed drinks in every night & it also had wireless access at a reasonable rate so my eldest could facebook her friends on her iphone whilst we enjoyed drinks!!! The hotels breakfast room overlooked the canal with spectacular views and breakfast was varied and of an excellent standard. The hotel doesnt have a lift, but we later found out no hotels in Venice do! But the staff couldnt have been more helpful with the pram etc. The reception staff were incredibly helpful, and spoke great English, we decided to go to Florence for the day and the guy on reception gave me everything i needed to know ...train times, directions to station, last train back, a map of how to get to the Vaporetto stop the most pram friendly way ...just fantastic!!! We had a quadruple room which was enormous, clean, and faultless. The communal areas of the hotel were very old world, elegant and charming. Overall this was yet another wonderful holiday in Italy made fantastic by the amazing Italien people both at this splendid hotel & in Venice itself.

Reviews.Title: “steep stairs and small room but comfortable and central”
Reviews.Author: LondonEyeball
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and central. It was easy to spot from the vaparetto as it's red and stands out form the rest. The nearest stop is the Rialto mercato which is about 5 mins from the hotel. Have a good suitcase with with wheels as there are some steps you have to cross to get to the hotel. The hotel itself is tucked away down some alley ways. The staff were all really lovely. The room was pretty small. I have looked at the photos here and we must have stayed in one of the standard rooms. Have a good look at the photos on tripadvisor as the rooms vary enormously! The weather was cold this week so I was quite glad the room was hot all week but I wonder what it is like when it gets warmer! The room itself, once I got over the shock of how small it was (it reminded me of when I was a student staying in halls at uni) was actually very comfortable and cosy. It had everything we needed and to be perfectly honest, we both loved it in the ned. It grew on us I suppose. The stairs from the 2nd to the 3rd floor are very steep. If you have any mobiltiy problems or a cardiac problem check which floor you are staying on as there is no lift. We are both young and fit but had to pause every time before attempting this set of stairs. I am sure I have toned up this week so it's not all bad. The breakfast room is lovely and very Venetian with a view of the grand canal. There is toast, croissants, yoghurt, a selection of cereals and fruit to eat. Coffee, tea, and orange and grapefruit juice are the drinks on offer. On Sunday there was a slight change to the selection available. Toiletries are available in the rooms. I am a woman who needs to have nice toiletries when I am on holiday. They have shower gel which is OK (so don't waste valuable space taking your own. Save it for shoes/clothes). There is plenty of soap. I think you should take your own shampoo and conditioner. I think the showergel doubles up as shampoo for those who don't mind what they put in their hair. There are plenty of towels and the room is so hot you don't really need a dressing gown. In terms of clothing I would advise taking plenty of warm clothes at his time of year. It's hard to walk around in high heels in venice so unless you really have to, don't bother. You need a good pair of walking shoes for daytime trips. Get a 3 day travel card (33 euros) as this is the best value by far and can be used on the vaparettos in venice and the bus which goes from the airport into venice. There are plenty of things to do and see which I am happy to give advice on if contacted. We stayed for a week and get bored easily so did loads of things to keep ourselves busy and out of trouble. One more thing I have to warn you about is eating out in Venice. It is really expensive. It doesn't look like it is that expensive until the bill lands in front of you with cover charge (per person of course) and service charge (12.5%) added on. At the beginning of the holiday we saw a pair of back-packers sitting in one of the quiet empty squares eating pizza out of its box on a really cold night. We thought it was awful but soon realised that we might end up doing the same by the end of the holiday! There is a fantastic japanese restaurant around the corner from the hotel (if you want a break from lasagne, and breaded veal cutlets). I have so many tips I could go on giving you but I don't want to bore you so I'll stop now. Venice is truly magical. You cannot fail to enjoy this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel Close to Everything”
Reviews.Author: WilliamGall
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms. The ground floor room overlooked the canal and was very pretty. The other room which was on the top floor did not have a view but a tiny terrace if you needed fresh air. The steps are steep and I wouldn't recommend the top floor to anyone with mobility problems as walking around Venice is exhausting enough, but the hotel staff carried the luggage! The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful - we all felt very comfortable and would recommend it. Venice is very easy to walk around and it is only 5-8 mins walk to the Rialto Bridge and St Mark's Square around 20 mins. The nearest water bus stop is only 5 mins. The breakfast was adequate with plenty of choice. The hotel is very clean and it did not matter to us that the rooms are not huge as we were out for most of the day and we found them to be spacious enough. Wi-fi is available for 3 euros per hour and there is a computer available for guests use.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Location Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: adelaidetraveller3
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel on the water's edge. The rooms are very nice, for a room on the water front you must pay extra and there is no lift in this hotel, the stairs are quite steep. We were very happy staying at this hotel it was very central to everything. Venice has great shopping and the best Gelati!

Reviews.Title: “After a "bump," a wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Beachbumman
Reviews.Content: The "bump" was that upon our arrival we were informed that due to plumbing problems, the "standard room" that we had reserved 6 months in advance was unavailable. Thus we were told that we would be put in one room for the first night and then upgraded to a superior room for the remaining 5 nights of our 6 night stay. I decided not to object on the spot, but to see the room that we were going to have for the first night. So, with all our luggage in tow, lugged by a doorman, we trooped up to the top (3rd? or 4th?) floor. The door opened (barely) to a garret that ordinarily was furnished with a single bed. A temporary second single bed had been added and with the small bar refrigeration there was not enough room for us and our luggage. This was our second trip to Venice and we have travelled in the intervening years to other places in Italy, but had dreamed of returning to Venice. I descended to the lobby and patiently explained to the manager on the desk that the room was not acceptable. I mentioned that I regularly review hotels on TripAdvisor and that in my prior visit I had stayed at another hotel that was nearer St. Marks and had been well pleased with it but had selected the Ca Favretto due to the praises sung over it on TripAdvisor. When I inquired if there surely were not another room available for the first night, the manager offered us a room on the first floor that, although it had a low ceiling and is at the level or below the level of the canals, was much superior to the attic closet that we had been shown. This room was almost spacious and the bath included a tub/shower combination. It included a king-size bed plus a day-bed. It was the only guest room on that floor and, I suspect, may often be reserved by folks who may have disabilities and not like stairs. As it was acceptable, we took it and then we were transferred for the remainder of our stay to a truly lovely room. While this room (214) does not overlook the Grand Canal, it may be the only room in the hotel with 3 large windows, two overlooking a walled garden (the entry to the hotel if one arrives on foot), and the third the canal beside a very grand Palazzo with handsome architectural features even on its sides. This room was very nice. The furniture was handsome, in good overall shape, with a terrazzo floor, ceilings of greater than ten feet high, windows dressed in damask curtains and lit by a Venetian glass chandelier. (There was a broken Venetian glass sconce that still worked but wobbled and one gilded flourish of the headboard was missing. But these flaws are in the character of Venice, which is all the more romantic for its decaying elegance.) The bath included a tub/shower, vanity, bidet, etc. and was relatively recent re-done, with newer tile. We made 214 our "home" by buying an immense bouquet of fragrant lilies that lasted our whole stay. The hotel provided the vase. We breakfasted every morning to the surprise of the wait staff on the balcony that overlooks the Grand Canal. (The staff assumed it was too cool. Thus, neither of the two bistro tables were ever set in advance. But we moved out there and every morning were then joined by others who agreed that the view and the experience were worth the cooler temperature which we found bracing but not discouraging.) If we had not had the "bump" that created a poor first impression, I would sing nothing but praises of this establishment. As we had that experience, but were able to meet it with a positive attitude that resulted in changes being made, we nevertheless had a wonderful time. We LOVE Venice. If you do as well, then I would recommend this hotel but caution you to secure guarantees in advance as to what room you will be assigned and if unavoidable circumstances require last minute changes suggest that you be prepared to meet them with "serenity," the signature, after all, of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, well cleaned though decor calls to mind a treasury of European Swap Meet finds”
Reviews.Author: froufroupaperie
Reviews.Content: If you're into a bit of history (who isn't when travelling to Europe?) and can tolerate the European flair of all things antique, then this quaint hotel is a good match. Be prepared for extremely steep staircases or a bit of a wait in their closet lift. Bathrooms are sufficiently clean and though their size was smallish, it afforded a roomier space for sleeping. Included breakfast was sufficient and in a pretty sitting/dining room. I don't necessarily think it's conveniently located, but, the quiet that comes along with staying away from the main thoroughways of Venice was what we were looking for. The service is graciously accomodating and we had no complaints on cleanliness. Beds are not nearly comparable to the Hilton's dreambeds, but, this is Europe after all. We could make do with aerobeds, if we had to... They do offer wifi in their lobby/lounge area and water-taxis had no problems locating this hotel. Overall, a very average rating...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LincsLady60
Reviews.Content: Standard rooms - very small. Bathrooms and power shower great. Beds very comfy. Use water/public taxi from airport to hotel direct or Rialto then private taxi. Dragging cases over bridges is no fun. Fantastic location for all sight. Breakfast only warm and same every day, but plenty. Would stay again and recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “During our 5 days in Venice, we thought of this hotel as home.”
Reviews.Author: Japle
Reviews.Content: Our room was in the back, overlooking the entry courtyard. It was very quiet and fairly small, as expected, but had a 2nd bedroom where we stored our suitcases. The hotel was originally built in the 14th century and has been nicely renovated. It's right on the Grand Canal. A/C controls are in the room. No elevators, which wasn't a problem for us. It's a 10 minute walk from the Rialto bridge and a 5 minute walk from the S' Stae vaporetto stop. Breakfast is included with the room and it's excellent. WiFi is available for 3 euros per hour. We'll be in Venice again next year and plan to stay there again. http://www.sancassiano.it/san_cassiano-en.htm

Reviews.Title: “quiet hotel with breakfast room overlooking golden palace...”
Reviews.Author: claire186543
Reviews.Content: comfiest hotel bed..with much venetian brocade, drapes and chandeliers. Modern style bathroom with roasting water on tap and fluffy bath sheets. Excellent helpful smiling reception staff. Grim unhappy breakfast attendant. Not 4 star breakfast.....the same each day, and not 4 star quality of foods. All guests quiet, non socialising. We ate the best in Italy tiramisu at 'Nona' reasonable restaurant nearby. We would have eaten there each night. Book tours with tickitaly before you travel. Choose secret tour of Doges Palace. We three 'girls' 20-62 loved our first 5 days on hols together in Venice. You don't need to be rich to eat out but we did pay nearly 6 euros each to sit at music cafe in St Mark's Sq, drinks expensive too but it had to be done once.

Reviews.Title: “This was our favorite hotel in Italy”
Reviews.Author: mamating22
Reviews.Content: We stayed in 3 hotels during our trip to Italy and this was our favorite. We had a wonderful room with a great view of the canal. Our room was large and was tastefully decorated. The staff were very helpful, answering any questions that we had. They were also very friendly. The hotel is in a great location with just a few minutes walk to most of the areas we wanted to see. The water taxi picked us up right out front at the dock. We loved Venice, and we loved this hotel. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Definatly one to remember :)”
Reviews.Author: Michb1989
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed at San cassiano for 4 nights. We got a shared transfer via travellink from the airport definatly worth it! Drops you right outside the hotel saves lots of time so within 30mins your in your room from the airport. The staff were so helpful! My boyfriend asked me to marry him on a gondola while we were there they arranged the gondola including prosecco it was lovely! The rooms are fantastic the cleanest and most powerful shower I have ever experienced in a hotel. The breakfast is typical continental which was the only very slight down point u easily get bored of it. Still acceptable though. Our favorite thing was being able to sit on the outside seating area overlooking the grand canal with a prosecco after the long walks. Hotel is only 7mins walk to rialto but takes about 20mins to San Marco so comfy shoes are recommended. Be warned if staying on 3rd floor of hotel the stairs are a killer after walking all day! Overall a fantastic hotel you won't be dissapointed!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good all round”
Reviews.Author: branny1947
Reviews.Content: Not easy to find,tucked away down a small alley but once found it has an excellent location fronting onto the Grand Canal. Perfect for a coffee or a beer in the evening. It is very convenient for all the main attractions and there are good inexpensive bars, cafes and restaurants within a five to ten minute walk. The rooms were very clean and tidy and the service very good and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Friendly and Helpful Staff. Would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: MargotHBirmingham
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as we were in Venice for the Regatta and wanted a room with a balcony overlooking the Grand Canal so we could watch all the fun in comfort. It fitted the bill perfectly! The hotel has its own landing bay as well, so booking a water taxi back to the airport on a very wet last day was simplicity itself - not so easy in many Venice hotels. The breakfast was plentiful, the staff helpful & friendly and the room sumptuously grand (true italian style). There were several good restauarants within easy walking distance of the hotel (albeit through a labryinth of roads which we eventually got used to finding our way through). Rialto is only about 6 minutes walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Magical Experience”
Reviews.Author: SouthamptonAmanda
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a magical trip to Venice with my mother and sister staying at the San Cassiano. The holiday was a surprise to celebrate my mother's 70th birthday. She was overwhelmed when she knew where she was going and the hotel lived up to all our expectations. Period elegnace mixed with an eclectic collection of furniture and art made a stunning impression on us all. The hotel staff are so helpful and nothing is too much trouble. Our room was so inviting with three very comfortable beds and a palatial feel. The fresco painted ceiling and glass chandeliers added to the ambience. The dining room and bar terraces overlooking the Grand Canal provided stunning views. There are plenty of restaurants and osterias near by at reasonable prices and the area is quiet to allow you to explore in peace. I would definitely recommend the hotel to anyone and we can't wait until we return.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous small hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: kev20
Reviews.Content: Neither myself or my wife had visited Venice before so this was something of a dream trip. We were not disappointed with this hotel in any way. I can't comment on any of the other rooms but our room overlooking the Grand canal was lovely. Very spacious and comfortable. Yes, the floor was on a bit of a slope and the furniture wasn't modern but it's a very old hotel. The location was perfect for us, near enough to reach Rialto and even St Marks on foot (the best way to explore Venice) yet far enough away to be peaceful. There is a boat stop just around the corner, as well as an interesting museum of modern art. Sitting on the small terrace outside with a drink watching the canal traffic pass by is just wonderful and we found the staff to be friendly and polite at all times. My only negative comment would be that the breakfast is a little dull. Ok if you are just there for a couple of days perhaps but we were there for a week. That's a minor point though. When we returned to the UK my wife discovered that she'd left some important books behind. The hotel were kind enough to post them back to us and only charged us the postage. We were both impressed with that.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL HOTEL. GREAT MEMORIES”
Reviews.Author: MIDWESTROOTS
Reviews.Content: Ca'Favretto is a wonderful hotel. It is a 500 year old converted residence. Its right on the Grand Canal. It is two blocks from the Rialto Bridge-one of the central points of Venice. It is about a 15-20 minute walk to St. Mark's Square. We arrived at the hotel from the airport by water taxi which are docked directly in front of the airport. The water taxi drive was a fifteen to twenty minute ride in a high speed 35 foot power boat. The trip was reminiscent of the James Bond movie from Russia with Love boat chasing scene. During the first few seconds of the boats unexpected rapid acceleration, my wife lost her new hat which she had purchased in Rome. However, our driver, chatting nonchalantly on his cell phone, while the boat jumped from wave to wave, was oblivious to this casualty. The "cab driver" pulled the boat up to the dock in front of the hotel, placed our luggage on the dock, and quickly whisked away on his yacht after retrieving his 100 EURO Fee. Yeah, a 100 Euros but worth every cent. Because the hotel is not large, check in was quick and efficient. The bell captain quickly retrieved our bags from the hotel's dock and we were ready to explore Venice in short order. It is five minutes from the Venice Water Bus number one which is was quite convenient. You learn how to use these water busses (vaparettos) which (which run all day and all night and are an incredible experience) quite quickly. The hotel is not luxurious but is very old world and quite comfortable. The staff was extremely kind and professional. They made us feel very much at home here. Breakfast was served every morning. Here there were eggs (cold if you didn't get up early) bacon, croissants, toast, cereal, fruit, meats, sausage, juice-in short-every kind of breakfast item an American could dream of or desire. The kitchen staff was low key and efficient. Our room was right on the grand canal and the view was spectacular. The room was quiet and comfortably air conditioned. There are a number of restaurants nearby. The night life of the Rialto Bridge area was also only a couple of blocks away. My wife and I loved this place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Fry_Travel
Reviews.Content: You know the feeling where you depart from a hotel knowing you made the perfect choice? This hotel was exactly that. The location is perfect. 10 minute walk to Rialto Bridge and Market, 15 minutes to San Marco. Close enough to all the action but far enough for a very quiet night's sleep. We booked a double room for 4 nights and were pleasntly surprised to be upgraded to a room over looking the grand canal after mistakenly being put into a twin room for the first night. The room (105) was beautiful with a postcard of a view. Breakfast was also very good - there are 2 balcony tables overlooking the canal and one of them was always available for us. Best to go for breakfast first thing or towards the end of service to ensure your breakfast comes with a fantastic view. Don't hesitate in booking this place. The staff are very helpful and we even got a free bottle of Prosecco after I proposed to my fiance on our 2nd day in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Beware- Dishonest and Rude”
Reviews.Author: teacher075
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review before, but want to save others from the awful experience we had at this hotel. After a long flight from New York , we arrived at this hotel only to be told they didn't have a room for us there, but were going to give us a room at heir parent hotel the Marconi. I told the manager that I wasn't happy because I had booked this 6 months ago and have never seen the other hotel. He became very rude and said he would pay for a water taxi to the other hotel and that was it. We paid for this 4 star hotel and when we went to The Marconi found out that it was a 2 star. The lobby was dirty, we could barely walk around the bed the room was so small, bed and pillows were hard, cracked walls , safe did not work etc. Given all of this on our return from our cruise we were suppose to stay at the Ca'Favretto another night. When we tried to cancel they said we could not and it had to be done through Expedia. Our cruise director tried to do that and it was not possible. We were stuck. When we got there they told us we had the wrong date and were going to charge us another night. They were so rude and dishonest that I just had to write this. Even if all else was well , the location is not in a good place and the breakfast was not good.

Reviews.Title: “Fine choice but look around before you book”
Reviews.Author: 7ContinentsX
Reviews.Content: This is a decent choice for a hotel in Venice but I'd recommend looking around to see if you can find something more "perfect" for you at a reasonable price before booking.
