Pros: wonderful to sit out in the morning and look at the Grand Canal traffic, quiet rooms, 7 minutes walk from a vaporetto stop, good common areas on ground floor (including a bar), staff was decent. Cons: Room was disappointing (yes I know it's Venice...but it felt run-down and basic with sloping beds, a bathroom that had seen better days, peeling paint, etc.) If you decide to stay here you are not making a mistake, but I wouldn't pay a premium for this hotel. I'll put it this way: if I go back to Venice, I'll probably try to stay somewhere else for a different experience, but I don't regret having stayed here. By the way, the walking map on the hotel's website to get from the vaporetto stop to the hotel is perfect -- we found it without any wrong turns.

Reviews.Title: “Living like royalty in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: starclippers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for three nights on our honeymoon and loved it! We had no trouble finding the hotel - just download the map from the hotel's web site and follow that from San Stae and you'll have no trouble at all. We loved our room - it's hard to complain about living in a palace with ridiculously high ceilings and beautiful antique furniture. I was happy to find that the bathroom was very clean and modern with good water pressure in the shower! The room is dark, but that's part of its charm, and you'll appreciate it if you're there in the heat of the summer! The room was air-conditioned, too, which was much appreciated. We had a room overlooking the Grand Canal and loved waking up in the morning and opening up the shutters to the windows to the view of the bustling morning traffic on the canal. We would watch people going to work on the vaporetto, people transporting crates of food to the market, police boats, water taxis, you name it! All the bustle could be a bit noisy, but as soon as we shut the windows it was perfectly quiet again, so we could choose what kind of atmosphere we preferred. Then we would head to the breakfast room for a breakfast that exceeded our expectations. We were able to snag the balcony each morning (there are two tables out there but we were always able to get one of them, probably because we are early risers), and enjoyed delicious coffee with steamed milk, toast with nutella, eggs, sausages, etc. I've heard breakfasts in Venice can be expensive so we really appreciated having such a great breakfast available and included in our room price. The service at the hotel was great. Each morning we would ask the concierge to make us a dinner reservation for the evening at a place we'd picked out in our guide book and he would call over to make the reservation for us. That was a huge service, as we didn't speak more than a few words of Italian but wanted to get in to these wonderful restaurants we'd read about. He was always courteous to us, as were the other members of the staff. Our last day we'd already checked out but left our bags for the morning while we went exploring. Then we came back and relaxed in the courtyard for the last hour before we needed to leave to catch our ship. A perfect end to a perfect stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lawmonkey55
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here during our first ever trip to Venice. The hotel is in an exceptional location being situated right on the Grande Canal and in the heart of Venice. Our room was spacious and clean if a little basic but we really have no complaints. Lovely place to explore this unique city from.

Reviews.Title: “As Beautiful and Welcoming as Venice Itself”
Reviews.Author: Seeker707
Reviews.Content: Well, after dragging our bags around for an hour and a half, we finally found this awesome hotel! (NOTE: Donâ€™t arrive on a day where they are having a rowing race in Venice. The water taxis donâ€™t run or you have to wait a few hours until they are back in action.) We arrived sweaty, tired, and dehydrated, but glad to finally be at our destination! The hotel is beautiful inside. Our room was GORGEOUS and overlooked the canal. I felt like I was in the Venice of the 1700s or something with the way it was decorated inside. Itâ€™s exactly what I think a hotel in Venice should look like. The staff was great! They were smiley and helpful, providing maps and places to eat without any hesitation or trouble. (As in, if they were on the phone they got off, we didnâ€™t have to wait until they finished a conversation among themselves etc.) We didnâ€™t have any problems with the hotel at all. Also, they have a small patio, which looks out onto the canal. It was simply lovely to sit out there after a long day of walking around and have some wine and relax. I would LOVE to stay here again and I would recommend it to anyone who is traveling to Venice!! NOTE: You can take a water taxi back to the train station, but it will cost you 50 euros. The ferry is three bridges away (about a 10 minute walk) and only costs 6.50 euros. This is DEFINITELY a better choice. While the hotel offers to call a taxi, they have no problem showing you where the ferry is, so donâ€™t be afraid to ask! Enjoy this gem in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: EssexLove2travel
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a two night stay at this hotel to coincide with my birthday. Having arrived at the bus station from Treviso Airport we caught the ferry ACTV up to the Rialto stop. This helped with finding the hotel as we passed it on our right-hand side which gave us an idea of the direction to head. Having crossed over the Rialto Bridge we followed the water and then uncovered the back alley leading to the entrance. It is not well signposted until you are on top of it. We left our luggage as we were early and the room was not ready and set out to explore straight away. Upon our return we were shown to our room on the second floor (215). I had said it was my birthday when booking so asked for a nice room. Unfortunately, although the room was a good size it was very dark and had absolutely no view due to the fact that it was down the alley. The building next door to us was being renovated which meant it was very noisy. Luckily we had ear plugs with us for the flight which I slept with both nights. It was also extremely hot (26 degrees at night). When we mentioned to the concierge that the air conditioning didn't work he said it was the law in Venice that you cannot use it until the 1st June. There was no mention of this in the room!! (Not sure if that is the case as another review said how efficient it was). Breakfast was your standard continental fare which is fine. It is served on the second floor. We were very fortunate to find a free table on the balcony over the Grand Canal as I got up for my birthday which was a bonus. We had taken some champagne with us for the occasion, but when we spoke to the desk staff were told we could only drink it in our room (dark and dreary) so took it out with us and enjoyed a far more impressive view. I cannot fault the location of the hotel once you have been out and about. We had a lovely time despite the fact that it did not live up to our expectations. We have stayed in some fantastic hotels over the years, but I would say this was a good 3* rather than a 4*. We will definitely revisit Venice but will be staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, fantastic location and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: maybee1978
Reviews.Content: We went to Venice to celebrate my birthday and it was the best birthday... EVER! I chose San Cassiano Residenza d'Epoca Ca'Favretto because of the description 'converted palazzo', 'antique murano glass chandeliers' and 'overlooking the grand canal'. It didn't disappoint! We were lucky enough to get a room overlooking the Grand Canal on our first night and it was gorgeous, amazing views and absolutely perfect. Although we only had it for one night the room we spent the other two nights in was just as comfortable - with another gorgeous chandelier. Venice has always been somewhere I'd dreamt of going to and it didn't disappoint in the slightest. Top tip would be to take a good pair of comfortable shoes as you'll be doing a lot of walking - but that's perfect to walk off all that gorgeous Venetian food!!! Also, if you get a chance, go to Ca'Doro a beautiful palazzo with great views and lovely courtyard garden and the Peggy Guggenheim museum.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - fantastic view of the Grand Canal from breakfast room”
Reviews.Author: holidayqueenEngland
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel, lovely antique furniture. Loved the balcony that looked out onto the Grand Canal nice to sit and have a evening drink. Our room was on the third floor (last flight of stairs are very steep - no lift in Hotel). Our room was very spacious with a small balcony and you good see the Grand Canal over the roof top. Our friends room however looked into the courtyard was quite small. The rooms were exceptionally clean with gorgeous chandeliers. The hotel is not far from the Rialto Bridge about a 10 minute slow walk, 15/20 minutes to St Marks Square. You can get across the Grand Canal by a two man gondola (0.50 cents each) it goes from the fish/fruit market which is near to the Hotel. This takes you across the Grand Canal (without having to walk to the Railto Bridge) to the Cannaregio area which has some good shops (cheaper) and a large supermarket. The Hotel offers a free water taxi to Murano to the glass factory ( wasn't any hard sell but someone did go round with you) but you have to find your own way back. Hotel would be quite hard to find, you need a good map and clear directions, we had pre booked a private water taxi to take us directly from the airport to the Hotel and we did the same to go back this cost approx Â£90 each way but between 4 people it wasn't too bad and you feel like royalty. We all loved our stay in Venice and would love to visit again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, charming, wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: akbhatia
Reviews.Content: The place was charming and had that great Venice feel; so if you're looking for brand-new with state of the art stuff and lots of room, it's not for you. The staff was very friendly and helpful, the room was spotless, the location perfect. It's little hard to find the first time, but everything is in Venice (get a good map!). The breakfast had lots of choice -and the breakfast room had a small balcony right on the Grand Canal. Like most places in Venice, it wasn't the cheapest and the room/bed were tiny; but I think that is to be expected. All in all, I got all I hoped for.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: hthappiness
Reviews.Content: The room was large, nicely furnished, and clean with a large modernized bathroom. The air conditioning worked well even with the 40 degree Celsius outside temperature! Breakfast was about average compared to the other hotels we stayed in throughout Italy. The hotel is hard to find the first time (but everything is hard to find in Venice!). Overall a good value that we recommend.

Reviews.Title: “25 Anniversary Trip”
Reviews.Author: sndybttm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the San Cassiano with a couple of wonderful friends at the end of an amazing trip to Italy. It was the perfect, relaxing end to a full and active vacation. The hotel staff was friendly and the outdoor deck was the perfect place to meet for a glass of wine before heading out for dinner and an evening stroll. By luck one evening we stumbled upon a regional volleyball tournament and were able to sit with the neighborhood people and cheer their team on. Our room was spacious and clean and the breakfast was a good start to the day. One word of advice I would offer is to take the water taxi directly to the hotel. We found several couples that had been wondering the streets for hours trying to find their hotel. It is not worth the hassle. I would also suggest that if you are going to take a gondola ride that you make the reservation with the hotel desk. They were very helpful and our gondolier arrived right at our dock to pick us up for a beautiful sunset ride.

Reviews.Title: “Small, friendly, cozy.”
Reviews.Author: Lionfeathers
Reviews.Content: The staff were really helpful and patient with my cluelessness. The breakfast was great, and the view out the breakfast room window was a bonus. I got some wonderful pictures just out the windows there.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect base for a weekend break”
Reviews.Author: lawriecottage
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this lovely little hotel in August last year on a weekend trip I'd booked as a special birthday present for my wife. Our 8 year old daughter came along too. Getting to the hotel was very easy, a couple of vaporetto stops from Piazzale Roma and then a five minute walk - even burdened with luggage. The hotel itself was very clean as was our bedroom and bathroom and the beds were very comfortable. The breakfast salon on the first floor had a very small balcony and with a bit of luck in the timing it was possible to sit out looking along the grand canal enjoying the very well stocked breakfast buffet. If one were looking to criticise, the very restricted view from our bedroom -onto a very narrow canal- made the room rather dark - but we hadn't come to spend time in the room so it wasn't an issue for us Sightseeing from here was very easy, the Rialto fishmarket was an easy ten minute stroll and you could easily walk to St Marks square in 30 minutes - or just as easily make your way there by Vaporetto as we did on two of our evenings. Would we go back here? - Absolutely!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastico, Bellisimo”
Reviews.Author: Brentwood-Traveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived at Saint Lucia railway station and took the water bus to San Stae stop. It was a tough slog to the hotel with our suitcases but what a joy when we arrived. Everything in this hotel was perfect, from the front desk staff, to the porter/bar tender who hauled our bags to our room on the 3rd floor. ( of course no elevator in a 500 year old building ) This hotel started our 4 day Venice visit and established the enchantment that was to be our time here in Venice, a quiet beautiful oasis in the middle of the hustel & bustel of Realto and Saint Marco. After a day of exploring it was always a great joy to return. The breakfast each morning was very good, and the breakfast room with it views of the Grand Canal was a great way to start each day. The staff was always helpful and when they directed us to the Osteria Antico Giardinetto for dinner it was such a treat - what a great ristorante right around the corner. Our daily trips to Murano, Burano, the Jewish Ghetto, Cannaregio, Saint Marco, the Realto Market & Ponto Realto were made easy due to our location. Just a short walk from the hotel to the Traghetto Stop ( 2 man gondola) takes you across the Grand Canal for 50 cent each way. My wife and I loved the atmosphere of this hotel with its antiques and amiable staff and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We HEART Venice”
Reviews.Author: Baba-Waga
Reviews.Content: My partner and I splurged on this fabulous hotel in mid-March. The location is truly amazing, sitting right on the Grand Canal and facing the magnificent Ca'Doro (House of Gold, now a gallery and museum well worth visiting). Our room was sumptuous, decorating with gold gilt and heavy mahogany furniture; the bed was very comfortable and the bathroom clean and functional. Breakfast was served in the dining room which also had its own little outdoor terrace where you could sip your morning espresso and watch the world glide by along the canal! The interior decor of this residence Ca'Favretto is stunning, the Murano chandeliers & matching lamps adorning every room are a visual feast indeed. The residence is a little difficult to get to amidst the winding waterways and alleys but if you stick to the directions you should get there no problem. We also asked the staff to recommend a restaurant as we were put off by the very dear and low-quality tourist-traps along the Grand Canal and they recommended a small no-frills local restaurant in the district directly behind the residence where the food proved really great (though still costly!)

Reviews.Title: “Traditional stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: hmdando
Reviews.Content: Hotel was lovely. Slightly out of the main locations, but not more than 5 - 10 minute walk from main areas. Great view of the Grand Canel. Breakfast on the terrace was wonderful as was a drink from the bar before dinner, enjoyed on the terrace. It was a traditional 14th Century building, which added a real wonderful element to our stay in venice. Staff were great, helping with everything we needed. Steps up to the third floor are fairly steep but nothing too difficult. Breakfast was really good, better if you got there early but choice was really good and good quality food. I would go back and I would recommend this to anyone. Real experience, beautiful view of the grand canel and made our stay in Venice really wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Was Fine But Staff Was Terrible!”
Reviews.Author: nddagwood
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed in a hotel in Italy with such an incredibly rude staff. The hotel itself is in a good location, the rooms are clean and typically sized for Europe. The hotel claims to offer WIFI but it only works in the lobby sitting by the front desk. It does have a lovely waterfront deck with three tables to sit at on the Grand Canal and there is a single computer available on the ground floor. Our room had a view over a side canal and if you leaned out you could see the Grand Canal. The room was also very quiet. Anyone with physical difficulties should avoid the hotel as there is no elevator and the steps are extremely steep. We stayed on the third floor and held on to the railing for dear life when coming down the stairs. Now for the staff. They were completely unhelpful and arrogant which, in my experience, is atypical for Italy where historically we have had wonderful experiences, including during past visits to Venice. We also witnessed the staff being very rude to other guests as well. I booked this hotel because of the positive reviews that I read on Trip Advisor and was very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jgolomb
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay at C' Favretto. The staff was terrific and the location is perfect - very centrally located for attractions and food. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place!”
Reviews.Author: belongsinamuseum
Reviews.Content: A very lovely hotel indeed. The staff were helpful and friendly without being lugubrious, the views were exquisite and the rooms were almost perfectly functional. The only problem we encountered was our toilet, which featured the weakest flush in the history of plumbing, and took upwards of twenty flushes on occasion! The breakfast room was often very busy, but the waiting staff were very efficient, so it was never a problem, and the breakfasts themselves weren't bad at all. Location-wise, this was a very tough hotel to find for the first time on foot (even with multiple maps) but frankly if you've only just arrived and are already tired of getting lost in Venice, then you've come to the wrong city! When you get close to the hotel there are clear signs to help find your way, and they have their own landing stage if you'd rather take the easy (but expensive) option of a water-taxi. We would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great location on the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: Tony1Ann
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in January to celebrate my husband's 60th birthday. We stayed on bed and breakfast basis and the choice at breakfast was good. Well worth paying for a room with a view of the canal. Fun to watch the 'rush hour' passing by. Great location, walking distance to most of Venice and some good restaurants nearby. The hotel has it's own water landing and because it was a special occasion paid for a private water taxi to and from the airport. Again well worth the money. If walking from water bus it is a bit hidden down a side alley but certainly a hidden gem. Easy to get around on the water buses. We visited the islands of Murano and Burano

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: momtripToronto
Reviews.Content: Style and character, nice quad room on the Grand Canal, close to Rialto, San Marco. Very clean, good breakfast. Private boat trip to Murano Island included, very interesting glass mfg./museum(return by public boat). Great hotel, we loved it.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: boksie
Reviews.Content: Ca'Favretto is a very nice hotel that will fit nicely into your Venice experience.If you are looking for a quiet,out of the way hotel that represents what Venice is all about then this is the place for you.If you are looking for big rooms,elevators and a nightlife,well,stay away from this hotel. There is a wonderful little terrace overlooking the grand canal where you can sit,relax and have coffee or a glass of wine. Breakfast is ok nothing fancy.Location is ideal for sightseeing and staff is helpful but a little uptight. Prices in the bar are tourists prices. We would definitly go back to this hotel and would recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what was expected”
Reviews.Author: DeborahHertfordshire
Reviews.Content: A local travel agent recommended this hotel as he had stayed at the Cassiano on 3 different occasions. The hotel was exactly as he described, great location, friendly staff. We loved the location of the hotel as it was only about 5 mins walk from the Rialto Bridge. The breakfast was tasty with good choice of hot and cold food. Lovely view of the Grand Canal if you managed to get a table near the dining room window. We paid extra and had a larger bedroom with Grand Canal view. The bathroom was clean, but rather small. Everytime you opened the door it hit the bidet! We travelled on the 9th March and was a little worried about the weather. We neednt have worried as it was lovely. The sun shone everyday for 4 days. In the evening you needed a warm coat however during the day it was warm enough to sit outside a cafe or bar and watch the world go by. We found a small cafe alongside the Rialto Bridge with a very small seating area outside where we sat with a glass or 2 or wine most afternoons. Would I recommend this hotel to my friends - yes!

Reviews.Title: “Slightly disappointing”
Reviews.Author: DMM321
Reviews.Content: Great service, very clean, good location. However pillows were thin and hard. Bed also was very hard. LOTS of stairs and no elevator. Except for breakfast no food service available. Light fixtures were beautiful but not enough light to read by. Windows faced wall less less than 2 meters away so no natural light either.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Amelaur
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in a quite part of Venice within easy walking distance to everything: 5 mins to Rialto bridge, 10-15mins to St Marcs (unless you stop to shop on the way), Vaporetto about 150 meters walk. Friendly and helpful staff, excellent breakfast for Italy right on the grand canal, beautiful rooms and great location. We had a very large room (Superior class I think) although the hotel obviously has some much smaller ones. Room was a little dark without the light on as it faced one of the small side streets. Huge chandelier compensated nicely. We will definitely stay here again when we come with the kids in summer.

Reviews.Title: “Wow - First time in Venice and Fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: destin878
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for my sisters Hen weekend (not the usual rowldy weekend). The staff here are so friendly and so helpful, nothing was too much trouble for them (apart from the night porter who wasn't that friendly but heplful if needed). The location is perfect, right on the grand canal and 10 minutes walk from Rialto bridge and about a 15 minute walk to St Marks square. The breakfast room was amazing, although its quite narrow, the views are just amazing. The breakfast was lovely, breads, meats, cheeses, scrambled eggs, bacon, cereal, fruits. It was lovely to eat breakfast and then enjoy a coffee on the balcony in the breakfast room and watch the vaparetto and gondola's go by of a morning. I stayed in a triple room and although a little dark, the furniture was gorgous and beds very comfy, and it was very roomy. My sister stayed in a suite with her friend and the views were amazing and when we return to this hotel (as we definately will), I would upgrade for the extra space and views. The mini bar in the room was fully stocked each day and was very reasonably priced as well. If you are going to stay in venice stay here and you wont be dissapoined at all. Oh and one last thing....if you have the money hire a private water taxi to take you to the hotel from the airport as this will take you straight to the hotel jetty and you will feel like James bond !!! It could be a little difficult to find if not but well worth it when you do find the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Highlander58
Reviews.Content: I wanted to visit Venice after seeing Francesco's Venice with Francesco da Mosto on the BBC back home and came across this hotel while searching the internet. Checked the hotel out on TripAdvisor and elsewhere and thought that this was the place for me. And what a great choice. The hotel is in a great location on the Grand Canal. It is very comfortable and nicely furnished in old ambience Venetian style. Ideal for seeing the sites and with a decent number of good restaurants in close proximity. Travelling alone, I had a single room which was really nice. Chandelier on the ceiling and gilt bed headboards. I didn't have a view directly onto the Canal but could see a side view from my hotel room. The staff were very friendly and helpful. When I first arrived and had dumped my bags (about 20,00 hrs ) , and said that I wanted to go for a walk in this (to me,newly arrived) strange town, looking aghast, the receptionist gave me a map showing the area and the hotel. No worries. Didn't get lost. Cheers. The breakfast was one of the best I've had on any of my trips. Nice little dining room with window and terrace overlooking the Canal. Juice, coffee, croisants, salami, ham, sausages, bacon, scrambled eggs. Getting to the hotel was easy . Get off at the San Stae vaperetto stop and it's only a few minutes walk away, Just follow the directions in other posts. All-in-all a great place to stay, Very comfortable and friendly. Close to everything. Even as a single traveller in this place of romance, everything was fine and dandy. If I go back to Venice then I would definitely stay at the Favretto.. Venice itself is brilliant. Lots to see. And riding up the Grand canal in the Vaperettos is well good. When there, try and see the Jewish Ghetto and try some Carpaccio - raw beef marinaded in balsomic vinegar.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location right on the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: SBfamily
Reviews.Content: It's true, the hotel is very hard to find (my tip is to stay left as much as possible once you leave the St. Stae Vaporetto stop), but what a location!! The hotel is directly on the water of the Grand Canal. It's in the quiet part of the Canal, away from the crowded areas of San Marco and Rialto. We took the bus from the airport to Piazzale Roma (don't take the city bus, as there are many stops before reaching Piazzale Roma. Take the direct shuttle bus.), then took the number 1 vaporetto to the St. Stae stop. We bought a 2 day pass for the vaporetto, which saved money, time, and hassle. Our room was the quad room on the first floor (which is the 2nd floor in American hotels), #103. We had two windows that opened up onto the Grand Canal. Breathtaking!! Honestly, we couldn't have asked for a better view. The room was a nice size for the 4 of us. The down side of the room were the beds and bathroom. The beds were hard and the pillow very flat. There was dust everywhere. The bathroom was so small, even the door to the bathroom couldn't open all the way because it hit the toilet. The free breakfast was very nice. Sit out on the terrace if there is an available table. The staff was very polite and accommodating. Overall, it was well worth the money. P.S. Unbeknownst to us the first night, there are metal window shutters you close at night to keep out the light (there was a spotlight pointed directly into our room). You have to lean out the window to reach the shutters and pull them closed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mteq
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 3 nights in January 2009. We arrived very late (around 0100) having received help from a very helpful policeman to find the hotel. Although we were very late, we were expected and made welcome by the very friendly and helpful desk person. The room we were given was quite small, but adequate, comfortable, well heated and very well furnished and prepared. The bathroom was large and airy. Breakfast was excellent in quality, and the breakfast room, if rather long, narrow and a bit crowded, was comfortable and had the most excellent view over the Grand Canal. The great treat after breakfast was to stand on the little balcony at the end of the breakfast room, drinking coffee and looking out over the water - wonderful. All our interactions with staff were very positive, and they were helpful and friendly. As far as we could tell, the hotel services seemed very good (Bar, internet access, etc.) although we didn't use them. The hotel entrance and foyer is very pretty. The hotel is difficult to find, especially if you are not used to Venice, and, as is inevitably the case in going anywhere in Venice, if you are carrying heavy bags it may be troublesome. But it is very close in one direction to the Vapparetto stop at San Stae, and in the other direction to the Rialto market. We did not use a water taxi, but if you feel up to spending the money, this would be the way to avoid carrying heavy bags down long narrow passages and over bridges. The Alilaguna stop to the airport at Rialto (Linea ARANCIO) makes access to the airport fairly easy. We had a wonderful stay, and would most certainly use this hotel again. We strongly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Fantastic View!”
Reviews.Author: Pen4Traveln
Reviews.Content: We stayed at San Cassiano for 2 nights in mid-December. We were there just after all of the publicity/media on the Acqua Alta (high water) of Venice. I'm so glad we didn't cancel! We are a family of 4, with 2 pre-teens and the hotel was a perfect choice for us. We had a room (deluxe) overlooking the Grand Canal. The room was huge and the view was amazing. And although it rained every day, the trip was wonderful. The room and hotel as a whole was clean and the staff very friendly. The breakfast each morning was delicious, but be sure to get there early. The hotel is more than prepared for high water and rain as they had umbrellas and boots available for folks. The free internet both in the room (requires a code) and the computer available downstairs was a nice benefit. The only negative was that we had a difficult time finding the hotel using their directions. We arrived after dark and decided to use the water bus vs a personal water taxi. We had to ask for directions several times. Other than that, the stay was great!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: 19yowzer92
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Ca'Favretto for 5 nights in the beginning of November. The staff was friendly, helpful, and courteous. The breakfast in the mornings was very good, going beyond the typical continental breakfast to include scrambled eggs, bacon (I think it was actually pancetta), and little sausage-type things. The cafe (espresso) with hot milk was excellent, although they will also make American-style coffee if you request it. I HIGHLY recommend making use of the breakfast room balcony, even off-season. I sat out there alone every morning, since everyone else seemed to think it was too cold. The views in the morning are simply amazing! You can watch the boats coming and going, delivering fruits and veggies to the Rialto Market, and some of the best pictures I took in Venice were taken on that balcony. I was traveling alone, so got the single room. I knew it would be tiny, so was not disappointed. Even though it was small, it was completely adequate and comfortable. There was a fairly large wardrobe, a writing desk and chair, a large enough bathroom with toilet, bidet, sink and shower, a mini-bar, and an opening window that looked down on a little side canal ~ beautiful! The staff was wonderful at giving directions, although I would recommend spending a few Euros to buy a good detailed map at a tobacco shop. That said, I was able to navigate my way through Venice using only the map given to me by the front desk of the hotel, although I got "lost" at least once every day. Actually, detoured would be a better word than lost, and it's something that you really should not try and avoid! My two favorite pictures in Venice were taken on my little detours. The hotel internet was free in 30 minute increments, and the hotel does have a bar, although it's not manned at all times. If you want a drink, all you have to do is ask the front desk clerk and they'll send someone in. Another huge perk of this hotel is the deck they have on the Grand Canal. I would sit out there after a long, hard day of touristing, maybe sipping a glass of wine, writing in my journal, or simply staring out on the canal at night. It was an incredible way to end each day. I agree with others who said that arrival at this hotel is easier with a water taxi. If you choose to take the vaparetto, get off at the San Stae stop, and call the hotel before hand to ask for directions from there. It's not far, but the streets are confusing. Also there are at least 3 small bridges that you would have to cross, so I wouldn't try it with a lot of luggage. This building is something like 500 years old, and I think it is simply beautiful. The only caveat I would give is that there is no elevator. My room was on the "3rd" floor (which would be the 4th floor in the US), and the stairs are pretty steep. Also, small rooms are standard ~ if you want or need a big spacious room in a hotel with an elevator, you probably shouldn't stay here. But if you want to stay in a small but historic Venician hotel, with glorious views of the canals, beautiful furnishings, and a wonderful staff, then this is definitely the place.

Reviews.Title: “A Little gem in Venice”
Reviews.Author: halbie23
Reviews.Content: We spent a pre-cruise night at the San Cassiano in Venice in Nov 08. We spent a lot of time on the net searching for a hotel in Venice; the hotels are very expensive and San Cassiano was relatively inexpensive for its category and position, so we were a little concerned about our choice. We were very pleasantly surprised to find the hotel right on the Grand Canal, with wonderful views! We had arrived very early so could not check-in but were offered coffee (complimentary!!) on the terrace. When we returned later we were even more surprised with our rooms which were beautifully decorated in Venetian style - lots of antiques and rich fabrics and chandeliers. Both rooms faced the Grand Canal and were the very essence of what one imagines to find in Venice. Breakfast was GREAT by European standards and included everything from cereal & yoghurt to pastries and even bacon and eggs. The staff were very helpful and polite and all spoke English. I would suggest using a water taxi direct to the hotel's jetty as the easiest way to arrive, (costly but worth it if you have heavy bags!) Request the front rooms if you have a choice. Excellent value-for-money and a very convenient location; about 15 min easy walk to St Marks Square and all the touristy sights.

Reviews.Title: “little price... little room...”
Reviews.Author: viaggisaggi
Reviews.Content: I had to be early close to Rialto in the morning for a job, carrying a heavy luggage full of documents, so I chosed this hotel for its location. I was also intrigued about how it was restored. The hotel is in a beautiful ancient palace, but most of the original flavour got lost (in my opinion). Still, it remains a good hotel: from the breakfast room there is an ample balcony that faces Canal Grande, and if you are fortunate you can get a table there. I was here in low season, I actually got a very good rate, at very small price, but also the room was very small, even though it had everything needed. I guess there are bigger rooms, at bigger prices. It misses the excellence score for few minor flaws and a refurbishment that has lost original soul of the place.

Reviews.Title: “couldn't be better”
Reviews.Author: mandlboyntonbeach_Fl
Reviews.Content: This was a 50th anniversary event for us and we took our children to Venice and a cruise to celebrate. We stayed at this hotel for one night before our cruise and one night after. I read all the reviews on tripadvisor but still had concerns about booking a hotel on line. What a surprise. The hotel and the staff were fantastic and were more than anything we could have expected. The hotel is delightful. The tired 6 travelers were met with afternoon drinks on the patio overlooking the Grand Canal. Our rooms were ready and were amazing. We booked standard rooms expecting small quarters. The double rooms were huge and pretty and overlooked at least some of the Grand Canal. The single rooms were quite small but adequate. On our return we were upgraded to the most wonderful room with a spectacular view. The location is great. Could walk anywhere. The staff was sensational and our trip was the best.

Reviews.Title: “loved it; great place”
Reviews.Author: castorpollux01
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for several nights back in March of '06 (spring break)... The staff was very friendly and the two bell boys (I think they must have been 12-years-old) who showed me to my room were funny and adorably quirky... While I was checking-in the bartender saw that I was tired from my journey and bought me a beer... Hotel had a very old world charm to it (i.e. - loads of character); it made me feel like I was in a Wes Anderson flick for some reason (that's a good thing from my perspective)... I would absolutely stay here again...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: kellucho
Reviews.Content: I read great reviews of this property but they didn't come close to the fabuous experience I had there. It was the perfect hotel to experience Venice. The rooms and the hotel were furnished with authentic antiques and Murano chandeliers. The room had a window facing the side canal with views to the front as well. The little terrace on the canal was a lovely way to start and end the day. The neighborhood was quiet and full of wonderful inexpensive restaurant and wine bars, every meal was amazing without the tourists prices. I went back for 3 more days and spent most of my time hanging out there again. Unfortunately this hotel was booked and my other hotel Bellini was quite wonderful but it didn't compare with this charming gem. You couldn't feel more like "I'm in Venice" and it enhanced the experience. The staff was charming and friendly, especially the breakfast attendant. I wish I would have gotten her name as she was so lovely and nice. The breakfast was fantastic with eggs, bacon and everything you would want. It is refreshing to see the amount of attention paid to the guests satisfaction and a staff that is truly concerned with your happiness. Especially when it involves a small property such as this. I've never felt sorry to leave a hotel before- and I was getting on a cruise ship. I can't wait to go back to Venice and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Bit Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: Silpa
Reviews.Content: After reading all the positive reviews about this hotel on tripadvisor I was really excited about staying at this hotel. We arrived in the evening and were told that the hotel had overbooked and they had no rooms left. We had booked a double room and wanted the trip to be special as we were celebrating our first wedding anniversary. They could only give us a single room for the both of us with 2 single beds squashed into it. When we got to the room it was tiny and barely enough room for us to stand. The hotel was very old with lots of cracks in the walls and ceilings. The next day we were upgraded to a superior room for the remainder of our stay which I have to say was not much better. The airconditioning in the room made a terrible noise and we were told it could not be fixed until the next day as the maintenance person wasn;'t around. Other than the problems we had the hotel was in a good location overlooking the grand canal with a pretty little terrace where you could sit and have a few drinks. The staff were very friendly and tried their best to remedy some of the problems. The hotel is only a 10 min stroll from the Rialto and there were some nice restaurants nearby that were much cheaper than the touristy ones near St Marks square. The hotel also organised a complimentary taxi for us to visit the glass making island of Murano which was well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: dhyink01
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the San Cassiano in July. We arrived weary after having dealt with delays due to a cancelled train. We traveled to the hotel by water taxi and were greeted at the front dock by one of the hotel staff who immediately took our luggage for us and carried it up to our third floor room. As we were checking in, we were encouraged to come down for a welcome drink after getting settled. The warm greeting was exactly what we needed and revived our spirits. We continued to be treated with great hospitality throughout our stay. The hotel location was very nice - in a quiet area, but right on the canal and not far from Rialto Bridge, so very easy to get to and from. We loved wandering through Venice, leaving our hotel with no particular route in mind, following the signs to Rialto Bridge or San Marco square. While the rooms were small compared to other locations we had stayed in Italy, I'm not complaining. This building was originally built in the 15th century - amazing to think of that. And the decor in the common areas was quite beautiful. I was a little disappointed with the layout of the breakfast room - it felt very crowded. However, I would not let that deter you from staying here. I would return and stay at the San Cassiano again.

Reviews.Title: “I don't get it either”
Reviews.Author: wanderlustak
Reviews.Content: I've been hesitant to write a review of this hotel due to all of the raving ones & feel I might insult people. At any rate, here goes. I don't get the glowing reviews. I stayed here in Dec. of '05 & did not get the"big wow" factor. The room was tiny, with a twin bed pushed up against the wall. Wall paper looked a little worn, as did the tiny end table next to the bed. Teeny TV. Window opened which had a canal view. Also window in the bathroom. Typical golden venetican decorations, such as gold wallpaper & bedspread. Flat pillow. Bathroom got wallpaper all over the place & was small. No lift. Believe me, I am not one to complain. I've stayed in youth hostels, shared bathroom facilities, camped, & worked/lived on boats. We've built our house out-of-pocket, by ourselves, & have lived in a "construction zone" for years. This hotel was fine, but I just don't get the over the top reviews. Maybe like most hotels in Venice, I was annoyed to have to turn in the giant key to the front desk every time I left. The front desk clerk seemed cold & not very willing, or not willing to go out of his way to help with restaurant, live music advice, etc. (Although he did pull out a map & draw on it for me.) The bell hop, Earnesto, was nice, but then seemed "too nice." I ran into him twice, once walking around the alleys, & another time on the vaporetto, & he invited me out to coffee. I hate to say it, but it seemed like he was hitting on me, so I tried to avoid him after that. I stayed out past 2:00 AM at a wine bar one night, & had to bang & bang on the front door to get the night desk clerk to open it. Again they had my key, but they locked the door. The breakfast was good & the view over the canal was nice. It was Dec. &, I guess, a little chilly, maybe for most people. There were only 2 outdoor tables, so I enjoyed my breakfast outside. I felt rushed with others making comments of wanting to sit out there too. (I wasn't out there very long.) The location is near the fish market & I loved walking along the alleys, almost feeling like I was going to get lost, to find the place. However, I think most anything in Venice is a good location. At least for me, the most fun was walking around the bridges & alleys. Such an eery, spooky, surreal, magical place. The next year I went to the Hotel La Forcola, which was something like $70 & I liked so much better. Very friendly French front desk person there. Lovely room w/ a better side canal view.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem with wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Travelgirl064
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at San Cassiano three times now - in 2004, 2006, and 2008 and we love it. Its hidden away in a little alleyway but sits right on the Grand Canal so you are close to all the sights. We have been in three different rooms and they have varied in both size and standard but that is because we chose a diferent rate each time. I would say their standard room was a bit small but then again we feel a room is simply for sleeping in so as long as the bed was comfy and bathroom functional (which they were) it didn't matter. On our last visit I commented to the staff how much I loved our room on our first visit and they moved us into it the following day as it was available. We sit out every evening on the little floating deck with a bottle of very reasonably priced wine from the bar watching the vaporettos go past and its just wonderful. The staff at San Cassiano are absolutely superb too, we have seen the same faces each time we have been which is very unusual for a hotel. I am already looking forward to my fourth visit...

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: c7999
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right on the Grand Canal but in a very quiet area, close enough to walk to St. Mark's but away from the horde of tourists and high food prices. Arriving by water taxi from the airport was great - right to the door. The staff was very helpful. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Zusya363
Reviews.Content: My wife and two young daughters had an excellent stay at the San Cassiano Ca'Favretto. This property was, for us, the perfect combination of being close to where we wanted to be (10 minute walk to the Rialto Bridge) and yet was quiet and peaceful in the evenings. Lots of good restaurants, in various price ranges, in the area. Short walk to the vaparetto with access to all of Venice. Breakfast was sumptuous and served in a wonderful sunny room overlooking the Grand Canal. There is a nice lounge and deck also on the canal. Rooms are nicely decorated and appointed; nothing lacking. Best of all was the personal service, thanks to Giovanni and his colleagues: we had a broken air-conditioner in one of our rooms; they sent for a portable unit from a co-hotel, which worked for one night then gave out; at that point, we were upgraded to an amazing room - all with an effort to making our family vacation a success, which it most certainly was. Throughout our too-short stay Giovanni and staff offered suggestions and information as if we were house-guests. We definitely recommend the San Cassiano - and will stay there again ourselves!

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Escaping_life
Reviews.Content: Having never spent a night in Venice before we were not too sure what to expect however we had a lovely two nights at the San Cassiano Residenza d'Epoca Ca' Favretto. The room was on the small side but very comfortable, and considering we spent all day walking around and seeing the sights it didn't bother us at all. Also when we stayed the temperature in Venice was in the mid 30's and very humid, however it was always bliss to come back to our room with the air conditioning! The staff are all very friendly and very helpful, and the breakfasts were great, a small selection but everything you need. I would definitely stay at this hotel again and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: westlondonlady24
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at this hotel on my first trip to Venice. On the Grand Canal with impressive views. Very near a vaparetto stop with easy access to all the sights but away from the crowds at the Rialto and St Mark's Square which was a bonus as it can get to be a bit of a scrum around those areas.The staff were extremely friendly and helpful and I was upgraded from a single to a double room which was huge.Although it was a little dark because of the low ceilings with beams I could live with this as the room was well furnished and beautifully clean and the bathroom was well lit. Very varied breakfast and, weather permitting, you can sit and have your breakfast on a balcony overlooking the canal. Free internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Palisade
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really excellent and I would go back immediately. We booked a superior room but on arrival we got upgraded to room number 37 which overlooks Canal Grande ! Very friendly staff, very conveniently located and the atmosphere is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely A Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: ChristineLim
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the San Cassiano for 3 nights in March and it was one of the most enjoyable stay I ever had after travelling to many countries. We reached the hotel via water taxi as 2 of us had 2 huge luggages each and decided to splurge on a comfortable journey. The hotel checked us into a courtyard room immediately even when we arrived way before the check-in time. Best of all, we were informed that they will be upgarding us to a Grand Canal room the next day for no extra charge since they have an available room. The staffs were friendly, spoke excellent english and were extremely helpful. Both the courtyard room and the Grand Canal room were beautifully decorated with lamps made from Murano glass. I will definitely recommend spending a little more on the Grand Canal room as the view you get is beautiful beyond words and it changes when you see it in the day and when the sun is setting. San Cassiano Residenza d'Epoca Ca' Favretto is definitely a hidden gem and I will definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: jomish
Reviews.Content: Such a pretty hotel located right on the canal! We arrived into Venice at Saint Lucia railway station and took a vaparetto to the hotel (3 stops). We took a much longer way going to the hotel only to discover the much shorter direct path on the return. Print out a good map but basically try to follow alongside the canal as much as possible and you should eventually find the signs. The breakfast room is so lovely (it reminded me of an english tea room) and the food was definitely better than your average Italian hotel breakfast. The hotel has its own dock and provides a complimentary service to Murano (the glass blowing factory island). The receptionist was extremely friendly and patient with all my questions. Rooms and bathrooms were all of good quality. Location was nice, only a 5 minute walk to the Rialto Bridge (if you don't include all the stops along the way for the shops) Would definitely go back here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: Oakledge
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. Situated on the Grand Canal. Our room was large spacious and beautiful. Lobby & breakfast room were beautiful. Excellent full breakfast. Excellent service. Helpful english speaking staff. Nice bar, & game room, free internet for 1st 1/2 hour. They were great with our kids. Held luggage after checkout for us on our last day so we could get in some extra sightseeing. A gem-- I feel selfish writing this review-- as I feel like I found a gem-- and I want to guard my secret!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: aschoc
Reviews.Content: Went for a short weekend break to Venice and had seen good reviews about this hotel so decided to book. As it was a special occasion we decided to treat ourselves to a Grand Canal view room. When we arrived (by water taxi which I would highly recommend as it is not the easiest place to find especially if carrying heavy luggage) we were informed by the desk staff that we were to be upgraded the next day. The first room was on the ground floor right next to the terrace/water taxi stop. It had a very low ceiling and dark beams but had a great view over the canal towards the Ca' D'or. Our upgraded room was right at the top of the hotel and had incredible views with a big vaulted ceiling. The front desk staff were always very friendly, we never asked for advice as we just wandered around but they seemed to be very willing to help. Although the hotel is not considered to be in one of the prime locations I think it is actually a benefit. This is because I find it nice because it feels less like it is in the tourist rat run. That said it is only 5 mins from Rialto and further 10 mins to St Marks square (or a bit longer if you get lost like we quite often did). There are numerous bars, cafes and restaurants in the streets around the hotel and I found them to be a better quality or price than those towards St Marks Square.

Reviews.Title: “San Cassiano Favretto”
Reviews.Author: Phantomjww
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel. It is on the Grand Canel and very close to the Riallto Bridge. The city market is also very close. We had a nice room with a mural on the ceiling on the 3rd floor. It was in the back of the hotel so had no view, but was quiet. The breakfast was nice. We followed the map on the hotel website and found it with no problem. You have to be careful to follow closely, the alleys are very tight and you might not think you are going in the right direction, but you are. We found the location very nice. It is the 3rd stop on water bus #1. We bought 3 day passes and took the taxi or walked everywhere. You are 10 minutes to bridge and another 10 to St. Marks Square. A great location, and the bridge and market are easy to find and good to ask if you need directions. Everyone is Venice is pulling luggage and looking lost so after a few days you will get questions about directions. We would recommend the hotel and stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Fond memories”
Reviews.Author: BromleyBug
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I wanted to stay in Venice out of season to avoid the masses. We had a marvellous few days in the city and the hotel really contributed to that. We treated ourselves to a private water taxi from the airport (90euros) and I would recommend that anyone planning to stay here do the same because it is ever so exciting - my stomach flipped as we left the lagoon and entered the canals. Arriving in style, I felt like a film star! We were greeted from the taxi and the staff were very welcoming. A charming man worked 'front of house' during our stay and he always had a friendly word to say whenever we saw him. We were offered a complimentary drink on arrival but were too excited to hang about so we 'hit' Venice armed with the map provided by the hotel. The hotel was conveniently situated, about 10 minutes walk from the Rialto and a bit longer to St Mark's Square. We liked being tucked away and enjoyed the strolls to and from the main tourist sights, passing retaurants and bars catering for Venetians and not mainly tourists. We felt very safe, even walking through the streets in the early hours of the morning. Our room was comfortable and clean. The shutters blocked out all light so we sept well, especially being so tired after hours of walking. We had plenty of wardrobe space and the mini bar was well priced. The small bar is a nice place to have a pre-dinner drink in the evenings. The breakfast room is really sweet, with the food items kept well-stocked, and we liked standing on the balcony and watching the canal traffic. Had it been summer, we would have made every effort to get one of the two tables on the balcony - what a location for breakfast. Venice itself was marvellous. So good, in fact, that we got engaged whilst there. It was the perfect setting. I would recommend the secret tour of the Doges Palace, taking the lift up to the top of the Campanile, visiting St Mark's Basilica, splashing out in Cafe Florian and/or Cafe Quadri (the latter was my favourite with less tourists packed in and gorgeous petit fours) and walking around the sestieres rather than catching the water buses. Only when you set off on foot so you really get the feel for the city. For a nice meal with fresh produce and good wine, I recommend Trattoria Da Bruno (52 Calle del Paradiso , Castello). We celebrated our engagement with an amazing meal at Cip's at the Cipriani. We took the complimentary water taxi (all polished wood and velvet) to the hotel's island in the lagoon and had a romantic candleit meal with views to St Mark's Square. It was expensive (25euros for a soup starter!) but worth every euro. A wonderful way to end a wonderful break in a lovely unassuming hotel. We hope to return and stay again in the San Cassiano Ca Favretto.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with character”
Reviews.Author: DIXYLUFC
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights in this hotel in November, we had a standard room on the 3rd floor overlooking the alley which is where the hotel entrance is located . The room was very quiet, spacious and clean, but very dark !! The windows did not let in much light due to the building opposite which is very close, like everything in Venice which adds to the character of the city. Everywhere is easy to walk to once you get your bearings and we only used the vaporretto once to get from the coach station on arrival from the airport. Found the restaurants in Venice to be either expensive or mediocre which is unusual for Italy! Except for the MADONNA TRATTORIA !!!! which is what you would expect in Italy good food, atmosphere and service with a reasonable price. It is near the Rialto bridge on the San Paulo side in a side street called Madonna. We went on our second night and decided to go on our last night but it is closed on a Wednesday. We ended up at the Aquila Nera over the Rialto bridge which was rather a poor substitute. The Alle Nono Risorte near Campo San Cassiano a 5 minute walk away is cheap with a good atmosphere but BEWARE !! the food is very salty .Go to the wine bars near the fish market before your meal they are good. The best place we found near St Marks square for a drink and excellent sandwiches is the Osteria da Baco which is in one of the side streets went there twice in the evenings and also went a couple of times in the daytime for a coffee and sandwich .Beware! You can still get bitten by mosquitos at this time of the year to our surprise as we both found out ! Overall this is a nice hotel and I recommend it fully.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven”
Reviews.Author: CLL040
Reviews.Content: We had been recommended to this hotel by a work colleague who had stayed there some time ago and loved it. We certainly weren't disappointed. On arrival we were given a complimentary drink on the terrace overlooking the Grand Canal as well as some useful tips on restaurants and sightseeing tours. Our room for the first night was on the ground floor next to the terrace overlooking the Canal and was very spacious with a good bathroom. For the next two nights we were upgraded to a junior suite on the first floor, again overlooking the Grand Canal. Yes it was full of old furniture but that's to be expected in a 13th century palace. However the bed was comfortable and the bathroom clean with plenty of towels. The shutters on the windows kept out the noise and the light so we had a very good night's sleep. The staff were wonderful and we took advantage of the free trip to Murano without buying any overpriced glass items. There are many good restaurants close by the hotel. Venice is just a dream and would be high on my list of places to recommend to anyone. It's very easy to walk around going up and down over little bridges and we walked through every district in the city. A boat trip to Burano and Torcello is also a must.

Reviews.Title: “nice pears”
Reviews.Author: schtum
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights, end of October. First night, had an upgrade to a room overlooking the Grand Canal, right next door to the breakfast room - fantastic sight out of the windows, but not sorry to move to the back of the hotel for the rest of the stay as the Grand Canal is the 24/7 wet equivalent of a motorway, and nearly as noisy! Standard of both rooms very good but the the canal-view one had creaky floors and wobbly furniture - still what do you expect in an old palace that's been sitting on mud for several centuries? Good breakfasts - lovely fresh fruit (hence the nice pears title...)as well as the scrambled egg, bacon, sausage, bread, cake, blah, blah - we never had to eat till about 3! Quiet location, but easy to find, loads of good restaurants within 5 minutes. Helpful friendly staff, all spoke just enough English. Don't be afraid of taking the free taxi-trip to Murano - yes, you will be set upon by chandelier salesmen but they will, eventually, let you say no, and the blast over the lagoon is worth 15 minutes concentrated sales patter. Although having explored Venice, we would choose to stay somewhere else next time, we would highly recommend the San Cassiano.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Petrach
Reviews.Content: We stayed in San Cassiano in Venice for 3 nights this October. We booked through Hotels.com and booked superior room. I was very excited to see what it will look like. However, I was very disappointed with the room. It was the room number 220. It was next to the restaurant so the noise of morning cutleries woke us up. The room was standard size with about five big cracks on the walls. The floor of the room was leaning about 15 degrees to the side and the TV on the fridge looked like falling off. The door on the bathroom did not close for the same reason. The furniture in the room was old and in my bedside table were stains as well as some piece of sellotape to hold it together. The golden mirror on the wall was also full of stains. Still don't know where did they get the "Superior" from? The view from the room was on the little canal. The restaurant was reasonably good size with small choice of breakfast but tasty one. As the room was so awful we spent most of the time sightseeing and returned only in the evening to drop in bed and have some sleep. Mind that apparently the Mayer of Venice does not turn the heating on until the 1st November so the room was cold as there were only blankets, no duvets. I would not go to this hotel again for the disappointment of the "superior" room we had. However, I would recommend to visit Venice to anyone, as it is very beautiful city, like a "toy town" my partner said and he was definitely right. It is magical place to visit.

Reviews.Title: “great front row seats for the Regatta”
Reviews.Author: RoxleyOz
Reviews.Content: Found this great and very charming hotel at travelshepherd at a great price the night before we arrived. (Heard the concierge negotiating a rate with a potential client over the phone and were staggered at the difference in cost!) We went to Venice to see the Regatta, not realising that this hotel had a terrace sitting right on the Grand Canal, so we had wonderful front row seats away from the crowds. Great room and lovely breakfast. Would stay here again and again.........just love Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Loved hotel san cassiano”
Reviews.Author: sara_lister1
Reviews.Content: We went to Italy for our honeymoon and stayed in Sorrento, Venice and Sardinia. Whilst we were expecting Venice to be fabulous, nothing quite prepared us for how romantic and glamourous it really is, quite unlike anywhere else we had ever been. The hotel is in a great location - just 10 minutes walk from the Rialto bridge, 20 minutes leisurely walk from St Marks Square and just around the corner from the vaperto stop if you want to travel everywhere by boat rather than walking. We paid the extra for a deluxe room with a view of the grand canal and it was well worth the extra money. The room itself was clean, spacious and very grand with lots of original features as was the hotel in general. The staff were always helpful and polite. We stayed on a B&B basis so we could sample several of Venice's fine restaurants. Breakfast was pretty much what you would expect from a tourist hotel but plentiful. If you're looking for a small hotel with lots of character in a great location, this is the place for you. We would definitely stay there if we visit Venice again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: norfolkteacher
Reviews.Content: Great location on the Grand Canal, but only a few rooms have much of a view. We looked down on to a side canal, but leaning out of the window could see the traffic on the canal. The room was very comfortable and clean. Breakfast was a little disappointing. We had better in Florence and Rome. However, you can not beat the view from the dining area. On Sunday as we ate breakfast on the balcony overlooking the canal we were able to watch a young man learn how to row a gondola. Take the free motor boat ride out to Murano but be prepared for the hard sell at the glass factory that paid for your ride. Staff was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful trip”
Reviews.Author: DaisySteiner
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a fantastic location right on the Grande Canal which you can enjoy from their breakfast terrace (get their early to guarantee your seat) or the lovely seated area on the small jetty both of which gives you a perfect vantage point to watch this beautiful city go by. The breakfast is plentiful and the quality good from cereals to bacon and scrambled egg. The hotel was immaculate and tastefully decorated (bar the big red penguin and pink alligator the hotel was sporting when we were there!) Apparently this is connect to the Biennale but I am not sure in what way. The room was a good size, had a powerful shower and was well maintained throughout. Staff were helpful. If you need the bar area in the evening, ask at reception as it is often not staffed but they will take care of you. The hotel location is great as it lies in close proximity to the fish market (a must see) as well as being only 15 minutes to St Marks Square. Most refreshing is that in spite of being close to these tourist attractions, the hotel itself is in a back street away from the tourists and is very quiet (but again close enough to reach local ventian eateries in San Polo and Santa Croce (cannot recommend "Il Zucca enough- fantastic food at remarkably reasonable prices). The only downside to the hotel is that it has three flights of stairs to negotiate if your room is on the highest floor as was ours. There is no lift so make sure to ask for a room on the lower floor if stairs are a problem. Venice really is a wonderful city, and our trip was enhanced by this great hotel. I would not hesitate to recommend it or to stay there again. On a practical level it is close to a waterbus stop and a tragetto crossing. However, I really recommend that you arrive by water taxi - much more fun and a fabulous way to start your holiday. Finally please don't be put off the the potential smell from the Canal. In spite of what you may hear, it really is not a problem!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Wakka
Reviews.Content: This was a really good hotel for the price we paid. My girlfriend and I stayed here in late March 2007. The room we had was huge, as was the bathroom. We arrived via the no. 1 water bus late one night. I must admit the hotel was a little tricky to find from the bus stop, but luckily we took all the correct turns and eventually found some signs showing us the way. I could imagine some people getting lost late at night in those small venetian alley ways (pay extra and you can get a water taxi straight to the hotel). The hotel is right on the grand canal and you can get a great view from the breakfast room. Also the bar area out the back was amazing (albeit small). One of the highlight's of our European vacation was sitting on the bar deck out the back drinking Peroni at sunset and watching all the boats go by on the grand canal. Staff were very friendly and even gave me a couple of free beers (I don't know why, I think they had confused me for someone else). The hotel is a short walk to the Rialto Bridge and then it's not much further to St Marks Square. Once you walk around a bit it is easy to get your bearings, and Venice is quite well signposted anyway. I loved this hotel and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast at home will never be the same again!”
Reviews.Author: cahilless
Reviews.Content: Hotel was excellent - staff friendly and very helpful, especially Ernesto. Rooms very clean and comfortable. Having breakfast overlooking Grand Canal takes some beating! Would certainly go again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: ScttLee
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, but seen better. No real complaints. Paid $120 for it. but not worth much more. Pros: Easy to find, easy to get anywhere. The double single room was clean and large. The staff was very helpfull. The free breakfast was extremely good, and has an balcony overlooking the canal. The hotel has a bar with outside canal seating, 5 minute walk to the Rialto Bridge. 2 minute walk to the boats. Safe in room. Cons: Bar is serviced by the desk staff, so slow getting anything; it also closes real early if the feel like it. No decent restaurants nearby. Doors close at around midnight, and do not open until 6AM; although if you let them know the day before, they will get up and let you out earlier. No internet access; I had to stay at two hotels, and neither had it.

Reviews.Title: “Better than 3-Stars!”
Reviews.Author: SAnderson30
Reviews.Content: What a very good quality 3-star hotel! Everything that could be wanted or needed in a base from which to enjoy Venice is present in this little gem. The reception staff are extremely efficient, and very knowledgeable of their great city, and are happy and willing to help with advice and recommendations. Breakfast is a simple but satisfying affair with fresh fruits and cereals, and eggs, bacon and sausage in plentiful supply. My wife and I stayed in a grand canal view room for 5 nights. The room was beautifully decorated, with a very comfortable bed and plenty of storage space. It had a nice little bathroom, with a great high pressure shower. The view however is why you pay the extra to stay in this room. It isn't quite directly opposite the Ca'Doro, as advertised, but it isn't far away, and the elevated view up and down the Grand Canal is very special indeed. There is a little noise from the boats in the canal, but hey, this is Venice, so it is to be expected. There is no noise whatsoever from inside the hotel, so the room is perfect, offering the best of views, and the best of peace and quiet in which to escape and unwind after the busy days in the city. Rialto is a short 5 minute walk away, but the hotel is sufficiently well hidden to be isolated from the thronging masses. There is no restaurant in the hotel so they only serve breakfast, but this doesn't matter as Venice is abundant in its eateries. Be careful where you go as it is very easy to find bad food here - most restaurants are no better than average at best (in our 5 night experience that is). We did however find one or two wonderful little places. For excellent pizza and buzzy atmosphere, try Nono Risorto - the choice of the locals, and very close to the hotel. For an evening meal, try Vecie Fritolin - delicious food with great service and atmosphere, and again very close to the hotel. The best of all the restaurants we ate in however has to be La Buona Forchetta on Calle de la Madonna. Itâ€™s a very well hidden and secret little place, but it was by far and a long long way the best food we had in Venice. A delighful little lady owns it and cooks everything fresh from scratch before your very eyes. What a pleasure. Also, find the Bacaro Jazz Bar, across Rialto and to the left, for an excellent choice in wine and very friendly and lively atmosphere for an after dinner drink - great fun! The hotel could pay a little more attention to its general facilities, for instance, they don't have an internet connection for their guests to use, which is unusual in this day and age, but at least there is one very near by. Similarly, the hotel bar which is so beautifully done sadly has a very 'dead' feel to it, and isn't really condusive to relaxing with a drink at the end of your day. It may be better served if it played some music and / or was attended by a full time bar man. My wife and I are much more accustomed to the 5-star hotel, and perhaps some of the reviews here may be forgetting that Cassiano has only 3. I however would not hestiate to rate this hotel as better than its 3 stars might otherwise suggest. The little things I mention above should not deter anyone from enjoying what would I'm sure be a very comfortable and pleasurable stay. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Central, quiet, and lovely”
Reviews.Author: KKincaid
Reviews.Content: An excellent location, not far from Rialto, but far enough eway from the bustle of tourist locations that you didn't feel like you were in the midst of the chaos. Friendly if reserved staff who were very dedicated to making your stay comfortable. Make sure you inform the desk if you don't like your room set at sub-zero temps after the chambermaid cleans the room. We arrived and departed by water taxi (warning! 45-80 Euros from train station), but otherwise took advantage of the vaporetto stops at St Stae or Rialto. If arriving for the first time by vaporetto, make sure you map your route carefully as it's a little tricky -- plus from any vaporetto stop there are stairs and bridges to navigate with your luggage. Breakfast was the same each morning (eggs, prosciutto, cheese, bacon, sausage, bread basket, cereal, canned fruit), but in plentiful quantities and in old-world ambience -- arrive early to assure yourself a balcony table on fine mornings. Murano glass chandeliers and wall sconces throughout the hotel, including your room. We had a side-canal view room (first-come) and slept with windows open - this can get a little loud when Venetians motor up at all hours, but otherwise it was pleasant to hear the water. Another favored view would be of the garden terrace. FYI to those staying long enough to do laundry -- clothes do not dry overnight in these rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: ERosasco
Reviews.Content: We started our vacation here and loved it. Our room was the one picured with the Grand Canal view. it was a pricer room but worth every penny. It was quiet and the room was really big. The man at the front desk provided the best service we received in all of Italy and he gave us an excellent dinner recomendation. I would stay here again and again. It can be a little hard to find, but everything in Venice is so don't let that stop you. The breakfast is the also the best we had during our entire stay in Italy--including bacon and eggs. We ate breakfast on a beautiful terrace right on the canal. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lots of character”
Reviews.Author: ausidadian
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three day weekend break at Ca' Favretto after reading posts about the hotel on tripadvisor. It's really close to the rialto bridge and off the beaten track so you aren't constantly walking with throngs of people. The hotel room was large and clean, and the shower was excellent. The breakfast was great, we managed to fill up so much we only needed to buy dinner each day, and on our second day we managed to secure one of the two elusive Grand canal side tables - very romantic. The hotel has lots of character, gold headboards, Murano blown glass chandelirs and lovely furniture. I was hoping to get a canal view room, but we ended up with a room on the second floor overlooking a smaller canal and someone's kitchen - which was actually kinda funky. In terms of previous posts about finding the hotel, I'd say if you're on a budget and you want to travel venetian style (i.e. don't want to spend big bucks on a water taxi) I'd go on public transport. We bought 3 day venice cards online for 30 euro each. This gives you unlimited travel on teh water buses (which cost 5 euro), regular buses (which cost 2 euro), and entry to all the public toilets (which cost 1 euro). We picked our cards up from the airport, got the number 5 bus to La roma, and the no 1 water bus (vaperetto) from their to San Stae. It's only a few minutes walk from there, and the map on the hotel website is easy to follow. Having the Venice cards meant we travelled just about everywhere and I think we saw a lot more than if we had had to pay for each trip separately. Definitely go to Murano and Burano (although it's worth noting that in august nearly all the glass blowing factories are shut for the holidays), and if you have time and the weather's nice the beach at Lido is a good place to chillout, and there are surprisingly few tourists (I guess they are all milling about feeding the pigeons in st mark's sq).

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: gms11
Reviews.Content: The hotel is comfortable with a good view of the canal and in a fairly quiet area. Our room was extremely large but on the first floor, right next to the front desk, and the bathroom was situated under the steps. Because of this, it was a bit noisy and cramped in the shower. However, the other rooms upstairs seemed quite nice. The staff was extremely accommodating and helpful in making sightseeing arrangements. However, be careful when planning a trip to Murano from the front desk staff. It is complimentary because you will be met in Murano at a factory, given a tour of the glass-blowing process, and then given a tour of the showroom. Our guide didnâ€™t use high pressure sales tactics, but since he paid for our water taxi, we felt an obligation. On the other hand, we were able to arrange a gondola ride that picked us up at the hotel for about the same price we would have paid in the square. One important note: It was recommended that we take a water bus instead of a water taxi to get from the train station to our hotel. Unfortunately, we had never traveled to Venice before and we were not familiar with maneuvering its walkways which can be very confusing at first. Taking a water taxi may cost a little more, but it will drop you off directly at the hotelâ€™s dock. This will save you from dragging your luggage and belongings up and down the canal bridges.

Reviews.Title: “A very so-so hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: pkmgolf
