Reviews.Content: Hotel staff (front desk) was very so-so, not rude- but not friendly either. We also received the dungeon room. Right near the front desk. The main room was nice but our shower was right underneath the main stair way up to the next floors. So there was no standing room in the shower, our shower was tiered and had mold on the underneath part of the stairs and roof. The wine at the hotel was terrible too, I would recommend buying a bottle and then drinking it on back patio by the grand canal- very nice. Breakfast was good. I would probably not stay here again, but it was not a bad hotel. Note to the first time visitors to Venice, very hard to get around but that is half the fun. Oh yeah, we did have one great experience, upon arriving to Venice we meet an individual name Ernesto who could tell we where lost and needing help, he ended up carrying my girlfriends luguage all the way to the hotel and turn out to be an employee of the Hotel (I think he was a maid or something). We also ate at a garden rest. on the way to the Rialto bridge and fish market, highly recommend it!!! Sorry, we forgot it's name. Expect a long wait, unless you have resverations, a lot of locals too.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend”
Reviews.Author: Annentone
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in early June 2006 at the San Cassiano. We arrived at Marco Polo Airport, caught the no. 5 bus directly outside to Piazzale Roma - Eu 2.00 then the No. 1 water bus from P.le Roma to San Stae vaparetto stop - Eu 5.00. (Others were taking the water taxi at Eu 90.00). We had a short walk to the hotel through the maze of alleys to the hotel and found it with no problems. The room was very grand with enormous windows but even though we had paid for a superior room, the view was of the courtyard, not the canal. Good bathroom and great big bed. Breakfast was good for a 3* hotel, with usual cold buffet of cheeses, meat, croissant etc as well as scrambled eggs, bacon and strange sausage. They serve breakfast until 10am which is good for late risers. The waitress in the dining room was smiley and very efficient. Though the hotel has a bar, no-one seems to use it. We did....just the once. The guy on reception had to leave his post to pour us a drink, then promptly disappeared. The hotel is about 10 mins walk from the Rialto and all the shops and restaurants. However, we ate one of our best meals in a osteria directly behind the hotel, Antico Giardinetto. Fabulous food and great wine. Our favourite bar was just over the Rialto Bridge- Bacaro Jazz - very 'hip'. They served good food and bellinis to great music, surrounded by pictures of Billie Holiday, Louis Armstrong and the like. One rainy day sent us into Harry's Bar for lunch. The most expensive lunch we've ever had but it was excellent. All in all a great holiday. AB Manchester

Reviews.Title: “Magnifico (and a hint)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Any reviewer griping about getting to the hotel is being captious--if you don't want to walk, don't go to Venice; there's no other way to get around. The San Cassiano is sort of Old World shabby-chic: knock-off antiques, sloping floors, dubious climate-control; but gracious, with large rooms and just a few minutes walk to the Rialto. We had a very pleasant stay. I think if I went back I'd stay there again. Suggestion: Only a handful of rooms front the Grand Canal, and as the price is DOUBLE a conventional room, it's pretty dear. We were up-graded, pleasantly amazed to find our room was in fact right on the Canal. My guess is hardly anyone pays the extra amount, therefore SOMEONE has to end up in those rooms. Happened to us, could be you--and if not, you can spend the evening on the bar's terrace with the waters lapping at our feet.

Reviews.Title: “So So Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: themenz
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights for a delayed honeymoon. The room was very large and the bathroom was somewhat small with nice towels. Bed was comfortable. Furniture was pretty good. The location is very good, but expect to haul your luggage for about 1/3 mile if you don't splurge on a water taxi. The deck is nice, but chairs could be more comfortable. The bar is nice with a very friendly waiter. The management staff was distant and not too understanding as you will read in a few moments. The hotel has no elevators and the steep stairs can be quite a handful after walking the city. Get a lower floor if you aren't up to it. Breakfast was nothing special, but the dining room has two terrace tables that are right on the canal, with a great view. So try to get one of those. Unfortunately they had turned the A/C off and did not tell us even after we complained about the heat. They do this to save money during the winter, but our room was on the third floor and got quite warm. When I asked management about the A/C, they insisted that it worked and told me how to operate it. But it was off and only after writing to management did we learn it was turned off all winter. We tried to open the windows for ventilation, but I was bitten about 12 times by mosquitoes as there are no screens. Again I complained and the manager insisted that there were not any mosquitoes in Venice that time of year. When I showed him the multiple bites and bloody spots on the walls where I had killed 4 in the middle of the night, he said nothing. We had to keep the windows shut and our room temperature at night hovered in the mid 80s F. I wrote to the manager about our issues. He has replied elsewhere in these reviews but he is defensive. He offered us nothing to compensate for our uncomfortable sleep and he did not even offer to tell his staff to inform the guests that the temperature control only goes up, not down during the winter. Why they would turn off the A/C is beyond me, especially at the rates we paid.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic find!”
Reviews.Author: JacquieB
Reviews.Content: We have just returned, having spent 4 wonderful days in Venice. This hotel is picture-perfect, retaining all the charm of a bygone era. If you're looking for a little piece of authentic Venetian grandeur, this one's for you!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wesbw
Reviews.Content: My stay at San Cassiano was absolutely terrific. I was there from March 16-22 in single room #331 on the top floor. Although the room was inevitably small, it was very comfortable, elegant, and had everything that I needed. What I was really impressed with is the soundproofing of the walls. I could hear absolutely nothing from the rooms beside me - no talking, running water, etc. There was an occasional noise from the hallway, but that happens in any hotel. Here it was not much problem at all because there were only 5 rooms in the hallway. I never heard a thing at night. The bathroom was quite adequate in every respect. The shower always had warm water and the water pressure was good. The towels were huge and soap & shampoo were provided daily. The staff at San Cassiano were always courteous and helpful, as well as very professional. I had to check out at 4:00 a.m., and that was no problem for them. There was an attendant at the front desk all night. The breakfast (included in the price) was better than I had expected. Every morning there were scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, cold slices of ham and cheese, about 4 different kinds of rolls, and fruits such as pineapple and peaches. I would always have an orange flavored drink that wasn't quite "orange juice" but it was good nevertheless. I thought the location was wonderful. Even though the hotel was on the Grand Canal, the walking route to the entrance was a secluded maze of narrow residential streets. There are no other hotels in the immediate area, and you can witness the daily life of Venetians just right outside San Cassiano. Once you get your bearings, you'll find that you can reach the fish market and the Rialto Bridge area in just a few minutes. Although I enjoyed the secluded location, it could possibly be a turn-off for some. It takes a bit of trial and error to learn the route back to the hotel, so you need a little patience. There are signs to help you as you get close. As a single traveler, I could certainly recommend San Cassiano for other singles. It is also a very romantic place, so I'm sure couples will enjoy it as well.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location and charm”
Reviews.Author: ccosbo
Reviews.Content: I have never bothered to post a review before but having just returned from hotel San Cassiano felt it was necessary to share my thoughts on this fabulous hotel. The hotel is situated directly on the Grand Canal with its own landing stage that guests are able to enjoy drinks on whilst overlooking the fascinating comings and goings of the busiest waterway in Venice. Everything is within easy reach with a Vaporetto stop nearby. Finding your way to and from the hotel is quite a task as the city is a maze, quite dark and spooky at times - fortunately I had my big bear of a husband with me otherwise I may have been too wary to venture out into the dark alone! However the city is very safe and incidents quite rare. Our room was clean, furnished in true Venetian style and excellent value for money, staff were helpful and breakfast served in a reception room overlooking the Canal. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Step back in time”
Reviews.Author: ostan
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Venice and we picked this hotel based on the TripAdvisor reviews which were by and large accurate and helpful. This is a charming hotel well worth staying in mainly because it gives one a sense of what it must have been like to live in a palazzo on the Grand Canal.It is a little off the beaten track on foot but none the worse for that - although one of the best bits of advice we gleaned was to take a water taxi from the airport, v.expensive but it is classy and I would not like to have tried to find this hotel in the dark on the first night! We had a superior room with no canal view (170 per night including decent breakfast). The room was fine, nicely appointed in keeping with the understated style of the hotel with good standards of cleanliness. The staff in the hotel were very polite and helpful in particular arranging a late dinner reservation on the first night in a nearby restaurant (Vecio Fritolin - also recommended). If you fancy a step back in time and a place with a little character, this could be the spot for you...

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 2 nights in Feb, the hotel is well located, about 5-10mins walk to the Rialto Bridge and everything else is easily walkable. The hotel is very grand, our room was a good size with a flat screen tv and large mini bar, the bathroom was modern and spotless. Breakfast at the hotel was good quality with a good choice, eggs bacon etc. we paid Â£100 per night to stay which we thought was good value.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place......”
Reviews.Author: Roineval
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March as we were getting married in Venice. The staff were very helpful, the rooms were fantastic with views of the Grand Canal and the breakfast was pretty good too. A short walk away from the Rialto right on the Grand Canal and a wonderful location to get to everywhere. highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY THE BEST!”
Reviews.Author: sheridansb
Reviews.Content: The best hotel we stayed at on our trip to Italy! We requested a room with a canal view - costs extra - the best money we ever spent!!!! Top floor, huge room and two windows that overlook the Grand Canal. Short walk to the Rialto Bridge and markets. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Venice. Thank you for a wonderful, memorable visit - we will definately return!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one night and very much enjoyed our stay here. Note to travelers: there is no elevator in this hotel. The hotel is right on the Grand Canal and is a five minute walk to the closest vaporetto stop. The bedroom was very small but beautifully decorated. Many of the furnishings were new or recently updated, despite the historic feel of the hotel. It ws a wonderful combination of an old Venician palace and modern day conveniences. The bathroom was small but spotless with a tub, a nice change from the can-just-barely-turn-around showers in most hotels in Italy. The man we dealt with at the front desk was not extremely friendly, but by no means rude. The breakfast offered was very good with lots of variety, including both warm and cold items. We highly recommend spending a bit extra and treating yourself to this very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Janey26
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in November with my boyfriend and we had a wonderful time. I knew that we would love this hotel as soon as we arrived when we entered the hotel through a small pretty courtyard decorated with lovely flowers in window boxes. The rooms were large and beautiful with striking red walls, deep red curtains and a regal double bed also covered in red. The room was amazing. We loved going for our breakfasts here in the morning as the breakfast room overlooked the grand canal and we would watch the gondalas and boats go up and down every morning after finishing our breakfast. It is a quiet hotel and the staff are very friendly and willing to help with booking restaurants etc. We paticularly enjoyed the friendly bar waiter who served us glasses of prosecco before we went out for our evening meal. One of the highlights of our holiday was the walk into St Marks Square every morning. The hotel is about 15 minutes walk away and every minute is a pleasure. On our first day in Venice we couldn't help but stop every couple of minutes to look at the interesting shops along the way. It was a pleasure to wander through the bustling Rialto markets full of fresh fish, fruits and vegetables - a real taste of Venetion life. If you like small and intimate hotels which offer something a bit different then this is definately the hotel for you. TIP - take a street map of Venice with you as the streets leading up to the hotel are quite winding - it will save you a lot of time when you first arrive there!

Reviews.Title: “Super little hotel”
Reviews.Author: ddarlow
Reviews.Content: In most respects, a perfect hotel. Brilliantly situated on the Grand Canal itself, with its own landing stage. Inside, a beautiful palazzo. Highlights were drinks on the little landing stage, watching the Canal traffic go by, and the superb breakfast. Ca Favretto is well situated - only a few minutes walk to the Rialto, and to San Stae vaporetto stop. There were only two problems: unless you were prepared to pay 50 Euros to travel the couple of hundred yards from the station by water taxi (85 Euros to the airport), it meant humping suitcases up and down three sets of stairs. But the biggest headache (literally) was the noise. The Grand Canal looks, and is, beautiful and romantic. But it's also like trying to sleep in the middle of a truck stop. The constant noise all through the night of heavy diesel engines, some of them revving up beneath your window, makes it very difficult to sleep. Clsoing the windw reduces the noise, but makes the heat insufferable, even in October. There was no air conditioning. So we emerged exahusted but happy!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful first visit to venice”
Reviews.Author: pinkandfluffy
Reviews.Content: first visit to venice with my husband and another couple booked san cassiano after reading reveiws on this site it did not disappoint arriving by water taxi it was dark the hotel looked warm and inviting huge chandeliers in the small foyer.the hotel is not large and we did not have a canal view but the room was great ,spacious with dark red walls high ceilings and again a fantastic chandelier matching soft furnishings lovely bathroom with bath and overhead shower.breakfast was in a small dining room with a couple of tables out on the balcony overlooking the grand canal there was the usual choices at breakfast rolls cheese ham cereals and superb scrambled eggs.there is a small courtyard outside the hotel entrance with a couple of tables.our only complaint (and it is a small one )is that we had problems getting a 'nightcap 'on our return to the hotel after dinner and were told the bar closed at 10.30 however we agreed to sit out on the deck and have our drinks it was not too cold if you wrapped up well and it added to the whole venice experience.San cassiano is a lovely hotel in a good location 5 min walk from rialto 15 20 mins to st marks square passing the markets en route. getting around venice is very easy on foot or catch the water bus from the nearby stop.i hope to return to this hotel and would recommend it to anyone who asked about staying in venice

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: helen118
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from venice. Had a great time. Hotel wonderful. Staff where great no question to silly. The only down thing about the hotel was if your not good on lots of stairs this is not the hotel for you. Very easy to fine if you follow the map from the hotel web site. Very handy for the water bus. Great way of geting around. I bought a pass to travel on the water bus. Great value. One thing i would say. Dont bother buying a orange venice pass. The blue one will get u into the museums and buses. Not needed to get into the loos. They are only 1E. planty about and they are clean. Best buy. The best buy was the 3E each way for the big blue express bus from marco polo.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Room on the Grand Calan”
Reviews.Author: brunswick4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in mid-September and loved it. We arrived via water taxi and had a room with huge windows opening onto the Grand Canal -- both were worth the extra money. The air conditioning was fabulous and the dock on the Grand Canal for use by all guests was wonderful, as was the stunning breakfast room (although we were never able to get the tables outside on the Canal). Despite being on the Grand Canal, we closed the windows at night and the room was very quiet. The staff was nice and spoke English well but were not overly helpful. The location was a bit out of the way -- we would have preferred being closer to the Rialto but, all in all, it was an amazing hotel.

Reviews.Title: “a great beginning to our trip”
Reviews.Author: Chicagojill
Reviews.Content: My friend and I began a two week vacation to Italy with a 4 night stay in Venice, in this hotel. We were careful to print out the map to this hotel, based on others' reviews. It came in very handy, but it did not show that all of the bridges (3) you must cross to arrive at this hotel from S. Stae water taxi stop involve large flights of stairs. We had a fair amount of luggage, and this proved to be difficult. I would highly recommend taking a private water taxi, which will drop you off right in front of the hotel, and is well worth the extra spend. However, don't let this deter you from a stay. The hotel was absolutely charming. The gentleman at the front desk was extremely gracious and accomodating in all respects. Our room was a bit small, but it was beautiful, with matching tapestry bedspreads and curtains and a venetian chandelier. The bathroom was small, but very modern. The air conditioning was a state-of the-art individually controlled ceiling unit. Breakfast was very nice, served in an elegant room. The hotel was very convenient to the Rialto bridge and all other locations. We walked all of Venice from here, and loved it! I will definitely return for another visit!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ridgevalley
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at this lovely hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful and English speaking. We arrived from the airport via private water taxi which dropped us right at the hotel door. While it's expensive (80 Euro), it's fast (25 min) and no hassles dragging heavy luggage through narrow streets or trying to locate the hotel. The dock has small tables and is just off the bar and lobby area. It is very relaxing to sit there and watch the canal traffic. There is also a very nice quiet courtyard with tables off the lobby. Breakfast was included and is served in a very elegantly decorated room with a view of the canal. An assortment of rolls and croissants, cereal, fruit, juices, coffee or tea as well as eggs and various meats and cheese were offered from 7:30-10:00. Our room was small and faced the narrow side street. However, it was comfortable and clean and nicely decorated. The canal view rooms are larger and more expensive. However who spends much time in the room? Our only complaint was a faulty shower knob that made turning on the shower difficult. We had an easy time finding our way to the Rialto bridge (5 min) and to San Marco (15 min). If we return to Venice we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Our 25th anniversary”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is superb-magic-romantic-Heaven. We have just spent our 25th anniversary in the most fantastic hotel-in the most fantastic city. We will be booking again this year because it delivered all its promises. Staff were excellent, friendly and welcoming. This hotel really should be a 5 star hotel! Can't wait to go there again.

Reviews.Title: “It was Okay...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I really don't see why others have given this hotel such a high rating. The service was okay, we had a std double and the room was small, the floors were dirty. In general it was not too bad but at 150 euro in the low-season I think we'll look elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: katymilli
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this lovely hotel for 2 nights at the end of July 2005. Chose the hotel as a result of the positive reviews on this site and were not dissapointed. Stayed in one of the Grand Canal view rooms which are definately worth the money - amazing views. Hotel staff were very friendly and went out of their way to assist with any requests and queries. The outside bar area is small but perfect. We thoroughly enjoyed sitting there with a glass of wine enjoying the view and watching the gondolas go past. The hotel is excellently situated only a few minutes from the Rialto bridge and no more than 15 mins from St Marks square at a leisurely stroll. We would definately stay here again and would whole heartedly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place from Which to View the Regatta Storica!!!”
Reviews.Author: stratasphere
Reviews.Content: Really wonderful hotel with spacious rooms and terrific ambiance. In the midst of a very hot, crowded week in Venice, we were able to sit outside on the little boat dock here and drink Prosecco while the historic parade of gondolas and boats passed by in full regalia. No better way to enjoy Venice! Atif, the owner, is friendly, warm and very accomodating as are the other staff members. This hotel seems to attract a really nice crowd of guests which also adds to the overall experience. My husband considers it his home in Venice and has stayed here many times.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: IanAP
Reviews.Content: We too thoroughly enjoyed a recent short stay at the San Cassiano. Download the street map from the hotel website to find the entrance though. Room decorations very pleasant, clean and in excellent condition. Very efficient air conditioning which we promptly turned off and opened the windows - you just can't please some people. Evenings with a drink on the landing stage, and breakfast on the balcony (so long as there aren't too many of you) was all that you can wish for in Venice. Only negative comment was that the bar seemed to shut at 10:30 which seemed a bit early. Restaurant Osteria Antico Giardinetto just around the corner very friendly and excellent fish (they run a stall on the market).

HotelInfo.Name: San Cassiano Residenza d'Epoca Ca' Favretto
